efficiency. As part of the finance team, you will provide the support needed to enable Skanska to achieve its purpose to build for a better society. Central teams are based at our head office in Hertfordshire with some roles based across the UK.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> We are looking for an Assistant Accountant to ensure an efficient standardised process. This will enable governance, reporting and accuracy of financial information to be channelled through to the wider business. Responsible for the management of revenue and service delivery.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> You will be responsible for:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Process receipts from customers including allocation to invoice and processing refunds<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Raise invoices, credit notes and record revenue postings<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Generation of invoice\u002Fcredit note\u002Fwrite offs<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Import of costs from subledgers through a transactional routine, and monitor any failure of batches<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Prepare and input standard journals to general ledger<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Preparation of monthly management accounts to trial balance<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Reconciliation of primary balance sheet accounts (AR)<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensuring sub ledgers have been posted to general ledger correctly (AR)<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> We are looking for:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> ERP system knowledge, Oracle Fusion preferable<\u002Fli>\n       <li> A thorough and up-to-date knowledge of financial and management accounting practices<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Detailed and analytical<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Customer focused<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. This includes courses, on-the-job learning, working in teams to solve business challenges, and building a strong professional network, all while improving the business.\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div><\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <b><br> Location: <\u002Fb>You will join our London-based team\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div><\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <b><br> What you will do:<\u002Fb>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <ul>\n          <li> Monitor and support the supervision of trade-contractors as well as the labour and material requirements for the contract<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Ensure our operatives are working to the latest programme of works, are signed up to the relevant method statements and check they understand what is required<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Be involved in quality and compliance<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Log and resolve any defects found and challenge current methodology by putting forward innovative ideas<\u002Fli>\n         <\u002Ful>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div><\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <b><br> Who you are:<\u002Fb>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <ul>\n          <li> Studying towards degree level, or having completed a degree, in a construction related subject that is accredited by the CIOB<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Have excellent communications skills and This is a key role where you will <\u002Fb><b>supervise site works including subcontract packages. Deliver work areas in accordance with company procedures, programme requirements and project specifications<\u002Fb><b>.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> You will:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <b> <\u002Fb>\n       <li><b>Achieve results through defining, assigning and delivering work, and team, objectives by managing other people. These could be your direct reports or be part of projects\u002Fareas that you work on. Manage the trade contractors including the production of working drawings, procurement and prefabrication and performance on site.<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <b> <\u002Fb>\n       <li><b>Oversee subcontractors, labour and material requirements for the contract and support Project Managers with matters primarily relating to on site activities.<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <b> <\u002Fb>\n methodology<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <b> <\u002Fb>\n       <li><b>Understand the design process, and work with the design manager, within cost restraints, to facilitate the design, and coordination of production information, to suit site requirements and conditions.<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <b> <\u002Fb>\n       <li><b>Regularly inspect works for compliance with design, and specifications, and class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p><b>Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> Support the Health &amp; Safety Manager in the management of H&amp;S for SCS activities, including the implementation of the H&amp;S Management System (HSMS) to ensure compliance with OHSAS 18001:2007 certification and with Works Information.<\u002Fp>\n       <p> The position plays the key role in helping to establish and maintain the highest and where possible, new industry Health and Safety standards for the project.<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <div>\n       <p><br> Main Responsibilities<\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li> Understand the SCS Health &amp; Safety Policies and Processes and statutory requirements as they affect the SCS operations and ensure that the requirements are implemented<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Provide operational and functional management advice on the practical implementation of the company’s H&amp;S policies and processes including external stakeholders such as customers if necessary.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Assist H&amp;S Manager or delegate and Contract Management in understanding of stakeholders (internal and external) aims, priorities and risks with regards to H&amp;S<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Assist, where needed, with the development of Health and Safety Management plans if applicable and coordination of review<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Provide operational and functional management with advice on the prevention of accidents, incidents and ill health<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Assist the SHE Manager and other members of the HSS team, in key tasks to assist in the development, management, implementation and monitoring of the Health and Safety Management System<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Undertake and\u002F or assist H&amp;S Manager and\u002F or Contract Management in establishing, managing and maintaining relationships with external stakeholders such as local authorities, HSE and others as required and directed<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Assist the H&amp;S Manager and other members of the HSS team, in key tasks to assist in the development, management, implementation and monitoring of the Health and Safety Management System.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Provide advice, guidance and independence with regards to the assessment of and appointment of sub-contractors<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Assist with and undertake H&amp;S surveillance where required of operational sites. Participate, as requested in parent company H&amp;S audits<\u002Fli>\n        <li> When directed, assist if necessary with the preparation of H&amp;S risk assessments and safe systems of work.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Assist with the monitoring, analysis of and reporting of H&amp;S performance. Utilise data to highlight areas of further consideration, evaluation and intervention<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Assist and\u002For manage the investigation of accidents, incidents, dangerous occurrences, near misses and other incidents as directed.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Assist in the preparation and implementation of H&amp;S training\u002F briefings, as directed.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Promote best practice, capture best practice and ensure it is fed-back into the business and parent companies<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Set standards and lead by example in the management of H&amp;S<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Liaise with the other members of the HSS Team and the wider organisation with regards to H&amp;S<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Maintain own level of knowledge and competency in relations to H&amp;S Management and responsibilities including appropriate qualifications and professional membership<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Obtain competency cards in line with the SCS Competence Card Compliance Standard<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Understand the Client and Joint Venture Partners' Environment and Sustainability Policies, Processes and statutory requirements as they affect the company's operations and ensure that the requirements, as applicable within their discipline, are implemented on the project<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p> The Ideal Candidate<\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li> Relevant experience in the field of Construction \u002F Infrastructure Health &amp; Safety<\u002Fli>\n        <li> NEBOSH Construction Certificate<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Membership of IOSH - Tech IOSH<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Collaborative behaviours<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. and Senior Works Manager in plant hire and equipment to suit the needs and demand of the project, ensuring continuity of the works in accordance with SCS Health &amp; safety procedures<\u002Fli>\n       <li> All plant and equipment must be adequately inspected as requirement by legislation<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Significant hazards\u002Frisks are identified to full risk assessment<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Current knowledge of heavy plant machinery maintenance, PUWER\u002FLOLER regulations<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Responsible for identifying any faults or damage to equipment<\u002Fli>\n       <li> with reference to plant assessments<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Complete quarterly supply chain performance reviews for and plant suppliers<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p><b>Graduate Design Engineer - Development Programme 2023 (Hertfordshire)<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We are looking for a graduate Design Engineer to join our 2023 development programme and help us shape the future of Skanska Technology (ST)<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> The Opportunity:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Skanska Technology provides a diverse mix of professional services including civil engineering, structural engineering, infrastructure design, green consultancy, project management services, air quality consultancy, Modern Methods of Construction (MMC) consultancy and noise and vibration advisory services.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> The industry is modernising and so are we. We invite applications from passionate free thinkers who aren’t constrained by how things are currently done and can bring a fresh perspective to our business.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> In return, Skanska can provide a great foundation on which to build your career with us: we will help you develop your technical skills by working alongside, and being mentored by, our technical experts working on some of the most challenging projects in the UK.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> The diversity of our projects will also equip you with wide-ranging skills you need in this exciting industry. A snapshot of our current projects include:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> civil engineering design on HS2<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> structural engineering advice on major infrastructure projects such as the Lower Thames Crossing<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> designing schools and colleges for the Department for Education Framework<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> providing green consultancy and carbon reduction advice for major projects in the rail and water sectors<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> designing water treatment facilities for Anglian Water<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> designing steel plants or major electrical substations for some of our external clients.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> Our two-year graduate programme will allow you to work with staff from other parts of Skanska to solve a range of business critical challenges, allowing you to develop your business skills in parallel with your technical skills and build a professional network to carry into your future career with Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> You will also join our ICE approved training scheme and will be supported and mentored in your professional development by our in house Supervising Civil Engineers.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> In combination, we will equip you with the technical skills, business skills, guidance, and mentor support to achieve your full potential and to become a professionally qualified Civil Engineer.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Location(s):<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Leavesden, Hertfordshire:<\u002Fb> Skanska's new UK head office with restaurant, gym, café and wellness centre just outside the M25.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> What you’ll do:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Further develop your civil and structural engineering design skills in relation to elements in structural steelwork, reinforced concrete, masonry, and timber<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Develop skills in the use of engineering and design software such as SCIA 3D, Autodesk Robot Professional, STAAD Pro, WALLAP, TEDDS, and other packages.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Obtain a good working knowledge of UK standards, specifications and best practice. We will build upon the skills you have developed in your undergraduate study and develop these in the use of the Eurocode suite of Standards. You will also develop knowledge of sector specific best practice \u002F specifications such as CESWI, or the Design Manual for roads and Bridges.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Be responsible for assisting senior members of the team to deliver technical design information including reports, models and drawings and specifications for Civil and Structural Engineering projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Improve your digital engineering skills, and work with our team of BIM technicians to prepare accurate 3D models for our construction projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Ensure that your work in the team complies with current legislation, the Skanska Integrated Management System, the Skanska Code of Conduct and industry best practice.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Who you are:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Studying towards or having completed a Civil Engineering degree, accredited by ICE<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> You will have an appreciation and knowledge of the engineering principles that lie behind civil and structural engineering design<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Ability to communicate new concepts and ideas to both technical and non-technical colleagues<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Basic knowledge of software relevant to design in the civil and structural engineering field as noted previously.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Appreciation and basic competence in the use of the Eurocode suite of design standards would be an advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Values driven and passionate about sustainability<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Keen desire to learn<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> What we offer:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> The opportunity to work on technically challenging projects, to maximise your development.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> A place on our industry leading Graduate Passport to build your business skills and corporate network.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> A supportive working environment with access to technical mentors, and a number of in-house SCE’s to support you with attainment of professional qualifications.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> A competitive reward package including a company car or travel allowance, where appropriate.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> An inclusive work environment where everyone is encouraged to be ‘their whole self’.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> Skanska is one of the world’s leading project development and construction groups and is an inclusive and responsible business that is helping to build a better society.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Drawing on our Scandinavian heritage, we are green, innovative, and progressive. We bring together people and technology, as part of our objective to make construction a safer and more collaborative industry.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> At Skanska, we believe in our Purpose: we build for a better society. Through our Values of care for life, commit to customers, be better – together, and act ethically and transparently you will enable us to deliver our Purpose.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Start date<\u002Fb>: September 2023<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Application deadline: <\u002Fb>28th February 2023<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. looking for a Electrical Shift Technician to join the team on site in Royal Papworth Hospital, Cambridge.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> The purpose of the role will be to efficiently and effectively carry out planned, breakdown and emergency maintenance of a wide range of engineering or building related services. To support in delivering a comprehensive estate service across all the areas of activity. The post holder shall perform AP\u002FCP duties for LV \u002F HV \u002F other which they are suitably experienced, trained, or qualified and appointed. The role is Electrical biased but when on site you would be required to make safe a range of tasks. Post holder will be working on systems such as ventilation, BMS, fire and Mechanical.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Skanska, one of the world’s largest development and construction companies, dates back 135 years and had a 2021 revenue of around £12.5 billion. We have 3,300 experts in the UK alone, could joining us be your next career move?<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><i> You’ll:<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Completion of tasks either as part of the reactive or planned work programme to a high standard <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Complete documentation as part of the record systems management requirements <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Undertake a variety of FM maintenance works<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Follow engineering and building drawings and specifications<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Determine what spares, components or supplies are needed in order to satisfactorily undertake and complete the work associated with repair or routine maintenance <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Complete all record sheets and paperwork associated with routine duties accurately and in good time<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Complete appropriate training (on or off site) and assist in providing training to others engaged on similar work<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Carry out inspection tests on new appliances in accordance with the department standards for PAT testing<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure all work carried out is to the standard of the associated code of practice (undertake training as required in support of this position)<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Follow Trust policies relating to Estates activities. This will include for example permits for work on Electrical \u002F mechanical systems, work in and access to restricted areas, work associated with emergency generators, work on patient related systems<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Complete job\u002Fwork details accurately and in good time either electronically or by hand<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake all work in accordance with Health and Safety practices<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure record keeping i.e. updating of drawings or plant history records<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake any other reasonable task as requested by the line manager in line with the trade\u002Fgrade of this position.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><i> We’re looking for:<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><br> Possess basic computer literacy skills.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Possess knowledge of building services and general building maintenance.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Have completed recognised level 3 electrical training and time served apprenticeship with AM2.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> 18th edition wiring regulations.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> 2391 \u002F 2394 &amp; 2395 Electrical testing.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> PAT testing.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Have a minimum of 2 years’ experience working within building and building services maintenance.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Evidence of working within acute health care premises would be advantageous (but not essential).<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Previous LV AP \u002F CP role.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p>Skanska, a leading construction company and developer, is an inclusive and responsible business that is helping to build a better society. Known for many major projects, we are creating, upgrading and maintaining the country’s buildings and infrastructure. Drawing on our Scandinavian heritage, we are green, innovative and progressive. We bring together people and technology, helping to make our industry safer and more collaborative.<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p> Our infrastructure team brings its design, build and refurbishment expertise to complex projects across the country. We form strong partnerships with clients and communities to deliver major infrastructure improvements like Crossrail, HS2, A14 and the M25 widening.<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p> As Sub Agent you will contribute towards the successful delivery of Skanska’s Infrastructure projects, ensuring they meet the required standards of time, cost and quality.<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <div>\n       <p><b><br> You Will:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Support the design team with the co-ordination of onsite activities and to ensure buildability input<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Drive the mobilisation and delivery approach, this includes mobilisation plans, pre-commencement documentation including RAMS, project management plans, construction programmes and deliverable schedules.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Support the Site Agent and procurement team to identify sub-contract packages, define scope and select appropriate supplier partners.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Manage all aspects of temporary works in accordance with Skanska process.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Drive commercial focus -understand the contract and apply it to ensure a successful commercial outcome.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Manage the site engineering team, ensuring the performance and development of Site and Section Engineers is a key focus.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Liaise continuously with Interface Manager to build stakeholder relationships<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Monitor and control site activities and subcontractors ensuring safety, quality and environmental aspects are compliant with HS2 requirements and Skanska’s - Our Way of Working.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Work closely with the supply chain and design partners to develop strong relationships fostering collaboration and demonstrating an integrated one team approach<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Support Site Agent \u002F Project Manager with meeting delivery requirements.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Be an ambassador \u002F champion for mental health and wellbeing across the project<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <div>\n       <p><b><br> We’re Looking For:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Appropriate Civil Engineering qualification – ideally degree or equivalent.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> SMSTS \u002FCSCS<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Experience of Interface and stakeholder management.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Commercially aware and familiar with NEC change management process.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Demonstrates behaviours and personal values that align fully with Skanska values.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Collaborative in approach with a focus on understanding and meeting customer needs.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Behaviours and personal values aligned to Skanska values.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. the Building Fabric and to assist with works to the M&amp;E Services, encompassing extra works and emergency procedures.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Skanska, one of the world’s largest development and construction companies, dates back 135 years and had a 2021 revenue of around £12.5 billion. We have 3,300 experts in the UK alone, could joining us be your next career move?<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> You’ll:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Assist with PPM tasks and extra work requirements . i.e. Room set ups<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Have a self-motivated ‘can do’ attitude required to work within the current site-based team. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Conduct maintenance and repairs to site assets<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Attend to internal areas including walls, partitions, ceilings skirtings etc. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Deal with minor Carpentry repairs and fixing of shelves and pictures. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>General labouring duties. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ensure maintenance &amp; inspection records are completed and submitted on a timely basis. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Escorting duties as required. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Work with other professionals within and outside fabric specialism. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ensure dress is not unkempt to the client.<br> <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <br> \n      <p><b>We’re looking for: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Minimum of City &amp; Guilds or equivalent and experience including Mechanical and Electrical knowledge other than trade bias. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Manual Handling <\u002Fli>\n       <li>(Training on Manual Handling can be provided)<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p>Our UK-wide building team has built a reputation for high quality offices in Commercial and Mixed-used developments, Healthcare, Custodial, Defence, and Education. Our award-winning projects include 52 Lime Street, 30 St Mary Axe, Bristol Schools, St Bartholomew and the Royal London Hospitals to name a few.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> As Procurement Manager for the Building Unit you will lead and develop the project procurement function, including the development of the project procurement strategy, to successfully procure the relevant trade contract packages, goods and services meeting the needs of the project.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> You Will:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Support operational teams at both tender &amp; project delivery, through the timely completion of procurement activities.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Set and deliver the project procurement strategy that leverages best commercial positon.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Feedback on Building Supply chain performance at project level including any data collection and information that is required. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Work with the Head of Strategic Procurement to contribute with Market Intel to support Best Value on Procurement <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Manage both existing and future supply chain relationships at project level.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> We’re looking for:<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><br> Sub contract and material procurement experience with working knowledge of relevant forms of contract, particularly JCT forms of sub contract.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Extensive supply chain market place knowledge and network.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Working primarily at operational level, supported by strategic experience.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Self-starter and able to work on own initiative to deliver to agreed timescales.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Competitive and effective negotiating skills both externally with supply chain but also internally with all levels of management.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Computer literate in word &amp; excel and purchasing systems.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Effective communicator, both written and presentation.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <b><br> Please Note: This role would be based at our new Watford based office but would require occasional travel to either our midlands or southern based projects.<\u002Fb>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. Our joint venture team is working on sites at Euston, Old Oak Common and West Ruislip, building tunnels 13 miles long and up to 50m deep, supporting delivery of HS2 phase one.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> We are looking for a <b>SCL Shift Manager <\u002Fb>to join our <b>HS2<\u002Fb> team onsite in<b> London<\u002Fb>. You will be responsible for the SCL works on site, taking a significant role in delivery as well as managing aspects of time, cost and quality.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Responsibilities<\u002Fb>: <\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Identify risk and opportunity, advise the Sub Agents appropriately.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Be conversant with all drawings, specifications and related information for the works under their control and ensure a similar understanding within the team.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake and work with the Site Engineers to ensure all setting-out and quality control procedures are performed in a timely and efficient manner, so as not to impede the construction programme.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Develop a 28-day programme to benchmark productivity measures for the workforce. Assess actual programme and productivity achieved for review at weekly progress meetings. This should include resource requirements.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Skills and Qualifications<\u002Fb>: <\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Engineering Degree \u002F HNC or similar in a construction discipline.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> IOSH or SMSTS desired, SSSTS minimum.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Tunnel Safety Training Scheme (TSTS).<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Experience with SCL construction techniques – as a guideline 2 years minimum desired.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Temporary Works Appreciation desired.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. Please contact us using <b>recruitment@skanska.co.uk<\u002Fb> if you require any adjustments that would support you throughout your application.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> More information about the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Please note this is an advert for our job vacancy, and therefore may not be inclusive of all assigned duties, responsibilities, or aspects of the role described, and may be amended at any time at the sole discretion of Skanska. For a full role profile, please contact us: <b>recruitment@skanska.co.uk<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Closing date<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> The closing date for this vacancy may be subject to change any time at the sole discretion of the business.<\u002Fp>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        <p>We have an exciting opportunity to join an expanding team focused on delivering social value improvement across the Building operating unit for some of our recently secured London based iconic projects.<\u002Fp>\n        <p><\u002Fp>\n        <p> This is a vital role in which you will support projects with their social value requirements by developing and delivering project Social Value plans. <\u002Fp>\n        <p><\u002Fp>\n        <p>Plans will support customer and local authority social value requirements and will need to align with the Skanska focus areas of employment &amp; skills, carbon, inclusion &amp; diversity and supply chain. <\u002Fp>\n        <p><\u002Fp>\n        <p>The role will also involve working with, and maintaining positive relationships with, multiple stakeholders to deliver the requirements including schools, community organisations, local authority departments, supply chain partners and customer representatives.<\u002Fp>\n        <p><\u002Fp>\n        <p><b> You Will:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n        <ul>\n         <li> Develop project‐specific social value plans which support customer, local authority and Skanska social value aspirations<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Develop social value reporting process on projects and inputting into internal and external reports<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Form positive working relationship with relevant regulators particularly local authorities<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Build positive relationships with supply chain to support them with their s106 targets and relevant local authority employment mechanisms. Encourage their support of wider social value aspects such as school engagement programmes<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Maintain good relationships with Industry bodies e.g. Considerate Constructors, Build UK and sharing communications and best practise around the Skanska business<\u002Fli>\n        <\u002Ful>\n        <p><\u002Fp>\n        <p><b> We’re Looking For:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n        <ul>\n         <li> Good understanding of the preferred Social Value Act, Construction Playbook, Public Procurement Note 06\u002F20, Social Value Model and the National TOMs or other similar social value measurement tool<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Experience of implementing these in a demonstrable way preferred<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Experience of delivering contractual obligations desirable<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to engage with wide range of stakeholders essential<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Experience working with local\u002Fgovernment bodies.<\u002Fli>\n        <\u002Ful>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p><b>Graduate Project Manager – Anglian Water<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> Skanska Group uses knowledge and foresight to shape the way people live, work and connect. More than 135 years in the making, we are one of the world’s largest development and construction companies. We create innovative and sustainable solutions that support healthy living beyond our lifetime. Established in the UK in 2000, Skanska has more than 3,300 local experts delivering projects across sectors including real estate, defence, education, highways, rail and water.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> Anglian Water @one Alliance is a collaborative organisation made up of our seven partner companies (Anglian Water, Balfour Beatty, Barhale, MMB, MWH Treatment, Skanska and SWECO) and our extended supply chain, delivering over half of Anglian Water’s capital investment programme.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> We understand we need to build an enthusiastic and talented workforce which can provide us with innovative and different ways of working to keep the water flowing throughout our regions for years to come.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> With this in mind, we have created a brand-new Project Management Graduate role which will see you gain a holistic understanding of the @one Alliance through rotational placements and a structured support programme across our teams. The end goal would be that you would build the knowledge, skills and expertise to be a future Senior Leader in our organisation!<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> What you’ll do:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p><br> Complete value-added projects across our Project Delivery, Commercial, Engineering, Solutions and Site\u002FCommissioning teams. You’ll not only develop your project management skills, but you’ll also implement tangible improvements which you can look back on with pride.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Develop an understanding of project management techniques which promote collaboration, synergy and outperformance to deliver against our overall goals and objectives<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Lead a variety of projects across different teams whilst honing your stakeholder engagement and management techniques<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Use theory, innovation and investigatory techniques underpinned by data and evidence, suggest new ways of working\u002F approaching work<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Be accountable for your own development by working outside of natural comfort zones and learning from mistakes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Utilise your presence in different teams to share knowledge and create efficiencies where possible<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Who you are:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p><br> You will hold or be in your final year of achieving a Business Studies or Project Management degree. Whilst previous project management and continuous improvement exposure would be beneficial, we are more focused on your potential to grow and behaviours.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Always operating with the customer at the heart of what you do<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Motivation and ability to pick up new IT systems quickly and optimise their outputs to produce data and analysis to underpin your ideas to enhance procedures and processes, and ultimately, outputs<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Have excellent communications skills and attention to detail<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Enthusiastic about learning and developing new ways of thinking<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> What we offer:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p><br> Clear learning and development opportunities to build your knowledge, skills, and behaviours to prepare you for your career at Skanska beyond the graduate programme<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Support and guidance from experienced commercial teams<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Professional and social networks<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Project management and leadership development mentoring<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Opportunities to volunteer at least one day per year<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Competitive benefits package<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> You may find an area of our business which you thrive in and are passionate about, which we will fully support you with<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Skanska graduate programme<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> The two-year graduate programme provides a pathway to develop a complete skill set, developing both technical and interpersonal skills. The programme includes interesting courses and on-the-job learning.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> As part of the graduate programme, teams will embark on projects to solve business challenges. These projects provide exposure to graduates and senior colleagues in the company and build a strong professional network whilst improving the business.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Programme start date: <\u002Fb>September 2023<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Location<\u002Fb>: You will be based in our Peterborough office<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. for a Commercial Assistant to join the team on-site at on one of our Bristol MEP Projects.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> The purpose of the role will be to report on a day-to-day bases to the project MEP Commercial Lead (Senior QS\u002FCommercial Manager), the Commercial Assistant will assist with the organisation and administration of commercial and financial aspects on the Bristol projects.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> The Commercial Assistant will be required to support with co-ordinating the flow of documentation and processes adhering to Skanska procedures in relation to supply chain payments, invoicing, and procurement in order to maintain commercial governance standards.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Skanska, one of the world’s largest development and construction companies, dates back 135 years and had a 2021 revenue of around £12.5 billion. We have 3,300 experts in the UK alone, could joining us be your next career move?<\u002Fp>\n      <p> You’ll:<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Review, validation and obtaining approval of any invoices and ensuring payment of any valid invoices is made in accordance with the Fair Payment Charter<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Updating of appropriate financial trackers<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Preparation of any ad-hoc commercial reports required by the Commercial Manager\u002FSQS\u002FQS.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Assist when required in preparation of any periodic information e.g. Not-passed and Aged debt reports<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Update the electronic storage folders systems to allow hard copy information to be stored electronically<\u002Fli>\n       <li> General office\u002Fadministration duties including but not limited to photocopying, filing, etc.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Inform the Commercial Manager\u002FQS of any recurring commercial issues, if necessary, escalate to Commercial Manager<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Completion of commercial administration tasks including but not limited to issuing Site Instructions, Sending Payment notices, raise requisitions online, raising requisition packages to be signed off.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p> We’re looking for:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><br> Experience of working in a Financial environment (2 years+) with understanding of commercial processes<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Experience of Oracle or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Good communication skills<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Good organisation skills<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Good computer skills including use of Microsoft Office, in particular be at an intermediate level<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Capacity to meet tight deadlines<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Strong problem solving and analytical capabilities<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Technical financial knowledge and decisiveness<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b><br> team.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> First point of contact for direct applicants, agencies and job boards.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Maintain the recruitment.work@skanska.co.uk mailbox to manage<\u002Fli>\n looking for a Project Director to lead the Design and Construction process, maximise the teams potential to safely and commercially deliver a successful project. Maintain the Skanska Brand, ensuring Clients, users and local community are proud of and satisfied with their development. approx £25m to £300m.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> You will:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Own and control the Contract Programme, the Mode and Method Strategy, the Target Programme adjustments (through the project planning manager) and the Package split concept (through the commercial lead)<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Chair appropriate management meetings including Client reporting meetings, monthly senior managers briefing meetings, monthly senior team meetings, Health and Safety meetings and briefings and Forecasting and reporting meetings.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Be actively engaged in and have overall responsibility for Method Statements and Risk Assessment before operations commence for all contractors and operatives.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Lead and develop the Project Plan and ensure its implementation reflects the Head Contract<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Agree the high-level financial reporting figures (CVR) with the Commercial Director<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Lead the prelims spend with the other members of the PET team<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Deliver a quality project that meets the clients agreed specification to time and budget. We employ a multi-skilled team of mechanical and civil engineers at the South Yorkshire site. Included within this is the tracking of Directory\u002FListings we are registered to and the expiry date of each registration.<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We’re looking for:<\u002Fp>\n       <p><\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li> Good working knowledge of 2D CAD, and 3D CAD.(Inventor) &amp; Tekla <\u002Fli>\n        <li>Working knowledge of using Microsoft Office, in particular, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p><\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. <div>\n       <p> To build on our success we are seeking Commercial Managers for our DFE projects to lead the commercial function by developing the strategy used to deliver project objectives, on time and within budget to the satisfaction of the client and shareholders.<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p> You will:<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Lead and Project that meets the budget.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Lead and develop the procedure for the monthly evaluation and repayment of works undertaken by the supply chain and ensure correct administration of all supply chain agreements to include change, notices and contra charges.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure all supply chain accounts are finalised and recorded and that the release of any retentions is strictly in accordance with the governing contract.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <div>\n       <p> We’re looking for:<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Previous experience capacity within senior management teams<\u002Fli>\n       <li> MRICS qualified highly desirable\u002Fdegree educated in a relevant subject.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Previous experience working on a DFE\u002FEducation contract<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, <div>\n     <div>\n      <b>ID: <\u002Fb>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      2228 \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p>Skanska, a leading construction company and developer, is an inclusive and responsible business that is helping to build a better society. Known for many major projects, we are creating, upgrading and maintaining the country’s buildings and infrastructure. Drawing on our Scandinavian heritage, we are green, innovative and progressive. We bring together people and technology, helping to make our industry safer and more collaborative. <\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p>Our infrastructure team brings its design, build and refurbishment expertise to complex projects across the country. We form strong partnerships with clients and communities to deliver major infrastructure improvements like Crossrail, HS2, A14 and the M25 widening. <\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p>As Senior General Foreman you will support the Works Manager and Agent to coordinate the safe management of our work, ensuring HSQE, programme and budget requirements are met. Additionally, to be responsible for the management of all sub-contractors and supply chain partners and to protect the public and any 3rd parties from any risks created by our construction activities.<br> <\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>You Will: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Build and develop a competent high performing team to deliver all aspects of the project requirements. Ensure the coordination of works across all disciplines, including suppliers, subcontractors, and Skanska enabling teams. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ensure that all documents related to specific tasks are briefed clearly to respective teams and recorded accordingly. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Develop strong working relationships with subcontractors and supplier partners. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Champion quality performance on the project to meet the specification requirements ‘first time’ and minimise rework. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Utilise knowledge and experience to influence working methods, plant selection and production outputs. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Carry out regular safety and environmental engagement tours and implement recommended courses of action as identified from progress monitoring and management inspections. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Implement reward system to drive the use of observation cards by your teams. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Keep a full and accurate set of records including Technical Assurance and Quality Managers in key tasks to assist in the development, management, implementation and monitoring of the Technical Assurance and Quality Management Systems.<\u002Fli>\n ensure no delay to construction activities.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Skills and Qualifications<\u002Fb>: <\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Strong understanding of site technical site inspections and\u002For audits.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be built a reputation for high quality offices in Commercial and Mixed-used developments, Healthcare, Custodial, Defence, and Education. Our award-winning projects include 52 Lime Street, 30 St Mary Axe, Bristol Schools, St Bartholomew and the Royal London Hospitals to name a few.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> To build on our success we are looking for a Construction Director to lead and oversee day to day Construction management of all construction activities of major and significantly complex projects effectively and professionally. This is a key role which involves overseeing the procurement, installation, and commissioning phases with a need for someone with experience of large Commercial \u002F Mixed-Use project experience.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> You will:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Develop and deliver contract programme in conjunction with Planning, Design and Commercial leads on the project.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Develop clear, detailed and practical measures of performance to meet project objectives. Regularly inspect works for compliance with design and report on progress, ensuring remedial action is taken within agreed timelines.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Develop clear, detailed and practical measures of performance to meet project objectives. Regularly inspect works for compliance with design and report on progress, ensuring remedial action is taken within agreed timelines.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure design solutions and construction methodology offered by designers and trade contractors fully comply with the project documentation within the given timeframes.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Add value to the design development process by challenging solutions and methods.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Be aware of monthly figures, taking proactive action to prevent losses and maximise profitability (with responsibility for project\u002Fpackage)<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Manage commercial control of trade contractors. In conjunction with the commercial lead, ensure contractual and claim correspondence is suitably actioned within agreed timeframes.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake line management responsibilities for direct report staff ensuring each is effectively managed, had a current performance review and development plan, and are able to carry out duties as assigned to them.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p> We’re looking for:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Extensive knowledge\u002Fexperience of the successful delivery of Commercial\u002FMixed-Use building projects of £150m plus.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Demonstrable building sector experience as a Senior Project Manager or major build projects.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Key understanding of programme and the importance of sequence within the Commercial\u002FMixed Use sector.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Demonstrable experience managing and leading a team at delivery phase.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Proven experience at operating at micro and macro<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Able to impart construction knowledge<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p>Our Building Services team are looking for a <b><i>Mobile Technician Supervisor<\u002Fi><\u002Fb> to join the team at one of our commercial property maintenance projects in London- Zone 1.<\u002Fp>\n       <p> The purpose of the role will be to ensure that our operational delivery performance is in line with contract obligations and Building Services business processes. Services to be delivered with high levels of customer satisfaction and ensuring that all sites remain compliant.<\u002Fp>\n       <p> Skanska, one of the world’s largest development and construction companies, dates back 135 years and had a 2021 revenue of around £12.5 billion. We have 3,300 experts in the UK alone, could joining us be your next career move?<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><i> You’ll:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li> Supervise a team of engineers to an effective level to maintain high standards of performance at all times<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Manage client and building users expectations and to aim for consistently high levels of customer satisfaction. Management of client relationship on a daily basis<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Manage agreed KPIs and SLAs, ensuring best use of all resources to ensure targets are met<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Responsible for managing the company’s H&amp;S and environmental performance on site<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Responsible for managing the company’s quality procedures on site<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Ensure that the site has adequate resource both labour and material to allow BS to complete contractual obligations<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Assist with employee succession and recruitment when authorised by senior management<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Assist with the development of all direct reports, which will include annual PDR process<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Effectively manage employee absenteeism<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Assist in the preparation of all reports required by either client or Building Services management team<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Represent Building Services at all client meetings, as directed by line manager<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Manage any additional business opportunities that will deliver client satisfaction and increase revenue<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Any other duties as reasonably requested by Skanska Building Services senior management<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Coordinate and take responsibility for all planned and reactive maintenance for all equipment, plant, services and systems<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Comply with all statutory and regulatory requirements, including Health and Safety legislation and safe systems of work<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Work safely on ELV\u002FLV and generated electrical systems in accordance with all statutory electrical regulations and health and safety legislation and regulations as appointed Competent Person (LV)<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Manage additional capital works. Arrange subcontractor attendance and provide detailed quotations, supervise work and carry out quality control and final sign off<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Diagnose faults and coordinate repair in accordance with manufacturer’s recommendations or best practice guidance<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Actively participate in the operation and control of engineering planned maintenance scheme and to complete all report sheets and test certificates where necessary<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Carry out electrical installations for new work or alterations in compliance with IEE Regulations, HSWA, and any other applicable regulations or legislation<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Be able to carry out mechanical services works to a competent level as outlined in the electrical to mechanical conversion course on plant, equipment and services<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Responsible for quality control of subcontractors work by using spot checks, audits and review of safety paperwork<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Undertake any training as required and to provide training, guidance, technical advice and support to the wider team<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Carry out mechanical and electrical (M&amp;E) services on all associated mechanical and electrical plant, Planned Preventative Services and Reactive Works in time and up to date where required<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Carry out M&amp;E Services, extra works and emergency procedures<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Ensure all statutory &amp; mandatory compliance maintenance and records\u002Fcertificates are kept up to date at all times in line with the contractual requirements and filed as Skanska Management System<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Ensure that CAFM systems and site records are up to date at all times reporting jobs to the helpdesk and in line with Helpdesk requirements<\u002Fli>\n        <li> PPM and extra work requirements in adherence to set engineering standards in accordance with HASAWA requirement.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Check and inspect mechanical services, plant and systems<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Assist, encourage and improve team engagement levels in accordance with YVOS<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Participate in and deliver interactive toolbox talks<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Encourage positive interventions and attendance at H&amp;S committee meetings<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p><b><i> We’re looking for:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li><br> Qualified in engineering discipline at NVQ level or higher<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Electrical experience essential<\u002Fli>\n        <li> 17th \u002F 18th Edition<\u002Fli>\n        <li> LV\u002FAP – Advantage<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Mechanical Experience - Advantage<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Experience of FM service delivery<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Sound knowledge of H&amp;S legislation and some knowledge of COSHH<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Ability to communicate both verbally and in writing with all levels of employee, customer and client<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Ability to manage and prioritise a demanding and varying workload<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Ability to deliver projects on time and on budget<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Knowledge of Concept CAFM systems preferred<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. Services to be delivered with high levels of customer satisfaction and ensuring that all sites remain compliant.<\u002Fp>\n       <p> Skanska, one of the world’s largest development and construction companies, dates back 135 years and had a 2021 revenue of around £12.5 billion. We have 3,300 experts in the UK alone, could joining us be your next career move?<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><i> You’ll:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li> Supervise a team of engineers to an effective level to maintain high standards of performance at all times<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Manage client and building users expectations and to aim for consistently high levels of customer satisfaction. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p>Skanska Technology Ltd (STL) is seeking to recruit a graduate \u002F Engineer to join our busy design team, based in one of our design offices Bridgend, South Wales or Leavesden, Watford.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> STL provides Civil, Structural, Highways and Infrastructure design services for a wide range of design and build projects within Rail, Highway and Water sectors, amongst others, to both in-house and external clients.<br> <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>The Role:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Reporting to the Senior Project Engineer, the successful applicant will be responsible for assisting our highways design team in the delivery of a challenging range of projects for a variety of public and private sector clients.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> The breadth of projects the team work on requires a candidate with a sound grasp of the Design Manual for Roads and Bridges and associated best practice design guidance along with a working knowledge of appropriate software tools including AutoCAD, Civils 3D and Microdrainage. <\u002Fp>\n      <p>This successful candidate will be expected to help grow the team and help secure future workload.<br> <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p>You will:<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Undertake designs, drawings, specifications and supporting technical reports and other technical output to achieve project outcomes.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake site visits, surveys, and investigations.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure work is undertaken in compliance with Health &amp; Safety and Environmental legislation.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Maintain and increase knowledge of Standards &amp; Codes of Practice.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Participate in CPD activities to ensure skills remain relevant.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure work is undertaken in compliance with internal quality standards and processes.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We are looking for someone with the following:<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><br> A BSc, BEng or MEng in Civil Engineering \u002F Highway \u002F Transportation or similar discipline, ideally accredited for CEng with the Engineering Council.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Preferably, working towards IEng or CEng with ICE or CIHT.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Experience in design and construction activities within the highway sector including drainage, pavement, and alignment design.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Experience with S38, S278 works desirable.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Knowledge of Highways England standards such as the DMRB and MCHW and other relevant design standards<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Working knowledge of software design tools including Key Lines, Key Signs, Civils 3D, AutoCAD, Micro Drainage as appropriate.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Flexible working<\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. for a Technical Lead- Medical Gas to join the team on-site at one of our projects based at St Barts Hospital, London. Would you be interested in joining one of our fantastic teams? If so, please register your interest and we'll be in touch. <\u002Fp>\n      <p>The Purpose of the role is to provide senior technical support and oversight to our dedicated teams and 3rd party supporting parties. <\u002Fp>\n      <p>As an experienced Compliance\u002FPackage Manager you will be well versed in ensuring our company adheres to legal &amp; statutory standards and in-house policies where applicable. You will be responsible for enforcing regulations in all aspects as well as providing guidance on compliance matters for one of the six statutory system packages <\u002Fp>\n      <p>Water &amp; Decontamination <\u002Fp>\n      <p>Medical &amp; Natural Gas <\u002Fp>\n      <p>Ventilation\u002FFire <\u002Fp>\n      <p>Boiler &amp; Pressure Systems <\u002Fp>\n      <p>HV\u002FLV &amp; P <\u002Fp>\n      <p>As a Technical Lead you will also be well-versed in legal and clinical guidelines and corporate governance and industry best practice. You will be a professional of high ethical standards and work diligently to complete your duties keeping in mind the objectives of the business. You must be comfortable holding yourself and our teams to account against their Statutory and Mandatory obligations and you must be results-oriented. Packages must be managed within the defined budget with costs tracked, reviewed and signed off on a monthly basis. <\u002Fp>\n      <p>As the Technical Lead you will own the delivery and completion of critical PPM’s including remedial actions. You will lead on defects pertinent to your package\u002Fsystem and own the relationships with Authorising Engineers and the OU compliance team ensuring audits, reports NCR’s and ACR’s are signed off by you with actions and recommendations closed with the Authorising Engineer. <\u002Fp>\n      <p>You will lead on lifecycle projects pertinent to your package\u002Fsystem and be a leader on introducing AI into future schemes. <\u002Fp>\n      <p>Skanska, one of the world’s largest development and construction companies, dates back 135 years and had a 2021 revenue of around £12.5 billion. We have 3,300 experts in the UK alone, could joining us be your next career move? <\u002Fp>\n      <p>You’ll: <\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Own the delivery and completion of critical PPM’s including remedial actions <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Lead on lifecycle projects pertinent to your package\u002Fsystem <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Be a leader on introducing AI into future lifecycle schemes <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Develop and oversee control and governance systems to prevent or deal with violations of legal guidelines and internal policies <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Evaluate the efficiency of controls and improve them continuously <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Revise procedures, reports etc. periodically to identify hidden risks or non-conformity issues <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Coordinate and facilitate monthly compliance reviews with the Project Company <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Review the business’s lifecycle and project plans to identify possible compliance risks <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Review the work of colleagues when necessary to identify compliance issues and provide advice or training or where applicable introduce performance improvement measures <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Keep abreast of regulatory developments within or outside of the company as well as evolving best practices in compliance control <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Prepare reports for senior management and external regulatory bodies as appropriate <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Create a Authorising Engineer review calendar and maintain and update <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Own the relationships with Authorising Engineers and the OU compliance team ensuring audits, reports NCR’s and ACR’s are signed off by you with actions and recommendations closed with the Authorising Engineer. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Create a key obligations calendar capturing when key reports are scheduled for completion and submission <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ensure all reports are presented in a professional format accompanied with a covering letter or email <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Create and maintain the Duty Holder Register and own the overarching training and development plans for engineers and technicians <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Monitor, manage and the implementation and accuracy of the asset maintenance records and the associated documents, ensure all stored in accordance with the site document control process. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Chair compliance discussions with our client(s) ensuring appropriate preparation has been made to present our compliance position <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p>We’re looking for: <\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>ONC\u002FHND in an Engineering Discipline (or Equivalent) or <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Recognised qualification or certification in a statutory discipline <\u002Fli>\n       <li>3 years Responsible or Approved persons experience <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Good customer care and flexible approach to working practices <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Proven experience as compliance manager <\u002Fli>\n       <li>In-depth knowledge of the industry’s standards and regulations <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Excellent knowledge of reporting procedures and record keeping <\u002Fli>\n       <li>A business acumen partnered with a dedication to legality <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Methodical and diligent with outstanding planning abilities <\u002Fli>\n       <li>An analytical mind able to “see” the complexities of procedures and regulations <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Excellent communication skills <\u002Fli>\n       <li><b>Equal opportunities <\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b>We
