   <div>\n          <p>Our UK-wide building team has built a reputation for high quality offices in Commercial and Mixed-used developments, Healthcare, Custodial, Defence, and Education. Our award-winning projects include 52 Lime Street, 30 St Mary Axe, Bristol Schools, St Bartholomew and the Royal London Hospitals to name a few.<\u002Fp>\n         <\u002Fdiv>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <p> To build on our success we are looking to add a Senior Planner in Tewkesbury to support on both bids\u002Ftenders and delivery of existing projects. You will work with the project team to ensure the programme, methodology and logistics are developed and maintained in a timely fashion to suit project needs, with attention to constraints, budgets, safety and quality, whilst enhancing our reputation with external clients and work colleagues.<\u002Fp>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <div>\n          You'll\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <ul>\n        <li> Develop strong working relationships with clients, consultants, sub-contractors and external parties to ensure a collaborative approach to project co-ordination.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Take responsibility for co-ordinating all 3rd party constraints, design, procurement and construction information into an integrated programme.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Work with the team to develop and maintain an integrated project programme.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Make project team members at all relevant levels aware of risks, key issues and solutions in a proactive manner.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Gather and record as built data on live projects.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Provide reports and progress information to senior management and client.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Provide suitable bid support at tender stage.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Comply with the Skanska Planning Guidelines contained within the business unit IMS.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>\n         <div>\n          <div>\n            Take a proactive role in the development of planning best practice as required.\n          <\u002Fdiv>\n         <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <p><br> We're looking for<\u002Fp>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <ul>\n        <li> Preference for a qualified builder ie.MCIOB.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Experience of planning for building projects - commercial and mixed use schemes with values greater than £50m.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Experience of Design and Build and traditional contract forms.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Tendering experience as extremely desirable coupled with seeing projects through to completion.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Self-motivated, strong communication and negotiation skills.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Proven track record of project delivery and programme management.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Competency in utilising planning software Asta Powerproject &amp; Primavera.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Experience of utilising BIM and 4D software such as Synchro is advantageous.<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p>Skanska, a leading construction company and developer, is an inclusive and responsible business that is helping to build for a better society. Known for major projects like the Gherkin and Crossrail, A14, Heron Tower, Barts and the Royal London Hospital, we are creating, upgrading and maintaining the country’s buildings and infrastructure. Drawing on our Scandinavian heritage, we are green, innovative and progressive. We bring together people and technology, helping to make our industry safer and more collaborative.<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p> We are now seeking a Carbon Manager to act as a focal point for all carbon reduction activities across the Infrastructure OU, including the delivery of the OU carbon reduction plan and ensuring alignment and consistency across the OU carbon reduction activities. This is a key role where you will be the carbon subject matter expert (SME) for Infrastructure and provide advise associated with the collection of carbon data at both OU and project level. Provide specialist support and advice at all project stages including: pre-construction, construction and post-construction.<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p> You will:<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Be responsible for tracking and monitoring delivery of all activities against the OU carbon reduction plan, as part of the overall Environmental EF programme of activities;<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Support the continuous development and maintenance of our centralised carbon resource library;<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Be responsible for coordinating OU carbon reduction plan, including sharing best practices, aligning approaches and ensuring consistency, where appropriate;<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Provide carbon reduction technical support to the OU, particularly in respect of carbon data and tools, in coordination with the Head of Environment and Technical Director;<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Be responsible for assessing and sharing carbon reduction best practice and learning across the OU, including development and management of any best practice \u002F learning tools;<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Collaborate with Env LT to support cross-BU carbon reduction best practice sharing and to support discrete group carbon reduction activities, as directed by Head of Environment.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Provide prioritised carbon reduction technical support to bids and other work winning initiatives, as appropriate to resources, time and importance<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Act as a visible representative of Skanska’s carbon reduction leadership to our markets and customers, including participating in brand and marketing activities such as speaking at events, involvement in industry bodies and publications, professional social media presence and other marketing activities.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n         We're looking for:\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        <ul>\n         <li><br> Relevant BSc or equivalent qualification in Environmental Science, Sustainability, Carbon, Energy or similar.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Experience in incorporating low carbon solutions into design or during the construction phase of a project.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> High level of knowledge on GHG reporting standards, guidance and regulatory regimes such as PAS 2080.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> High level of environmental technical experience and skills in construction \u002F built environment \u002F physical materials industries.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Good working knowledge \u002F experience of delivering carbon initiatives across a multi-sector organisation.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Demonstrable passion and commitment for sustainability, carbon reduction and environmental outcomes.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Chartered environmentalist or equivalent demonstrable experience<\u002Fli> .\n        <\u002Ful>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. Known for many major projects, we are creating, upgrading and maintaining the country’s buildings and infrastructure. Drawing on our Scandinavian heritage, we are green, innovative and progressive. We bring together people and technology, helping to make our industry safer and more collaborative.<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p> Our infrastructure team brings its design, build and refurbishment expertise to complex projects across the country. We form strong partnerships with clients and communities to deliver major infrastructure improvements like Crossrail, HS2, A14 and the M25 widening.<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p> As Site Engineer you will develop innovative solutions whilst inspiring others to deliver them with you, with a keen eye on environmental, health, safety and quality systems, you’ll ensure projects meet delivery objectives.<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <div>\n       <p><b><br> You Will:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Understand and interpret the project drawings, documents and specifications.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Monitor and control site activities and subcontractors ensuring safety, quality and environmental aspects are compliant with HS2 requirements and Skanska’s - Our Way of Working.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Prepare Method Statements, risk assessments and Task Briefings and raise permits to work as required.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Effectively manage quality and assurance processes support the development of Inspection &amp; Test Plans (ITPs)<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Line manage junior staff in accordance with the Skanska values and leadership profile, providing support and guidance as required.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Support collaborative planning, progress reporting and the production of short-term programmes.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Support Section Engineer and project team with meeting time, cost and quality requirements.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Supervise temporary works as required to suit the construction sequence<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Embrace innovation, specifically related to digitalisation of the construction process.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure assurance data is captured in a timely manner to support efficient and effective handover of the works.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <div>\n       <p><b><br> We’re Looking For:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Appropriate Civil Engineering and vocational training in Engineering HND\u002FDegree preferable<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Demonstrable understanding of Engineering Principles<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Relevant CSCS (Construction Skills Certification Scheme) card<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Behaviours and personal values that align with Skanska values and those of our clients.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Enthusiasm and a can do attitude<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. <\u002Fb>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      2269 \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p>We are looking for a Construction Manager for a section of the Works on our HS2 (SCS) JV in West Ruislip,London. Responsible for delivery including safety, environment, quality, cost and programme and reporting to the Section manager.<\u002Fp> \n       <p><b>Flexible working: <\u002Fb>We welcome you to ask about the flexibility you need. This might be part-time, remote working, or compressed hours for example. Anyone who applies for a role can ask about flexibility at interview. In return, we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n       <br> \n       <p><\u002Fp>\n       <p>Main Responsibilities<\u002Fp> \n       <p><b>Key Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n       <ul>\n        <li>Leading a Section project team, including subcontractors, suppliers and 3rd parties, including implementation of the health, safety, environmental and quality standards into construction planning and works.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Promoting and monitoring the roll out and implementation of SCS values and behaviours.<\u002Fli> \n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p><b>Health, Safety &amp; Environment:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n       <ul>\n        <li>Ensuring health and safety is given the highest priority in the delivery of the works.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Be familiar with, and demonstrate commitment to the requirements of the Health &amp; Safety and Environmental Policies.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Ensure that the Health Safety and Environmental Policies and Procedures are effectively communicated to the workforce and implemented.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Ensuring all work is pre-planned in detail through method statements and risk analysis.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Issuing a Section RACI matrix in line with the project organisation.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Work collaboratively with the HS2 team and other contractors, subcontractors works packages to achieve the overall project goals.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Conducting buildability reviews to integrate construction requirements and best practice into the construction programme and target price.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Development and submission of construction phase plans.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Producing in cooperation with other disciplines construction related H&amp;S, environment and quality documents in line with the construction programme.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Assessment of construction risks, development and implementation of mitigation measures including allocating responsibilities within the team and ensuring that suitable mitigation plans are in place and monitored.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Development and implementation of Stage Two mobilisation activities.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Ensuring sufficient competent resources are in place to deliver the construction of the project and the effective and efficient management of those resources.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Working with the planning team to develop and maintain and monitor a robust programme that is cascaded and understood by the entire construction team.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Working with the Design managers to ensure designs in place in line with the programme requirements.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Managing the supply chain to ensure that they deliver in an efficient way and in accordance with the Safety, Environmental and Quality requirements.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Understands costs and budget allowances for the section of works.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Understands the scope of the works and can identify change.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Promoting the pursuit of excellence and continuous improvement, driving innovation, adopting best practice, standard processes and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Guiding and developing the Construction team in terms of skills &amp; competencies as well as encouraging behaviours \u002F cultures supporting collaboration.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Ensuring and overseeing the professional development and progression of staff and ensure that all necessary training and briefings are identified and provided for the team.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Upskilling the Construction team to deliver a next generation Construction approach and continuous improvement.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Setting clear goals and objectives, roles and responsibilities for the construction team and ensuring good clear communication throughout the team.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Ensuring that the construction team provide support and assistance to other teams as necessary including the provision of all information for tracking and monitoring progress of the project.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Understand the Client and Joint Venture Partners' Environment and Sustainability Policies, Processes and statutory requirements as they affect the company's operations and ensure that the requirements, as applicable within their discipline, are implemented on the project.<\u002Fli> \n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p>The Ideal Candidate<\u002Fp> \n       <ul>\n        <li>Degree or equivalent in civil engineering.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Prior experience in a leading Construction Management function in a civil engineering project of similar size.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Thorough knowledge of the development and implementation of CMP and construction programme.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Knowledge of Environmental Minimum Requirements (including Code of Construction Practice, etc).<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Understanding of all facets of the construction process with strong ability for planning.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Expert knowledge of building products, construction details and relevant rules, regulations and quality standards.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Familiarity with construction management software packages eg P6.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Strong leadership, communication and conflict management skills.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Relevant CSCS Card.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>A Chartered member of a relevant professional body.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Track record of developing a proactive and collaborative relationship with the Customer teams.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Ability to establish and lead a safety-first culture with a track record of delivering projects safely.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Experience of working in an environment of a complex structure of stakeholders and ability to maintain good relationships throughout.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Strong interpersonal and leadership skills with a focus on the development of people in the team to realize their potential.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Able to demonstrate the application of systems and construction processes that develop a results-driven culture of excellence throughout the project team.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Can demonstrate leading supply chain relationships to bring innovation and best practice to the project within a commercial framework that ensures delivery to programme and budget.<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <br> \n       <p><\u002Fp> \n       <p><\u002Fp>\n       <p><b>Flexible working: <\u002Fb>We welcome you to ask about the flexibility you need.   <div>\n    <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p>Skanska, a leading construction company and developer, is an inclusive and responsible business that is helping to build a better society. Known for many major projects, we are creating, upgrading and maintaining the country’s buildings and infrastructure. Drawing on our Scandinavian heritage, we are green, innovative and progressive. We bring together people and technology, helping to make our industry safer and more collaborative. <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>Our infrastructure team brings its design, build and refurbishment expertise to complex projects across the country. We form strong partnerships with clients and communities to deliver major infrastructure improvements like Crossrail, HS2, A14 and the M25 widening.<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Buyer to join us on a project for a key client.<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>Reporting to the Senior Procurement Manager, you will be involved in the negotiation and placing of material\u002FPlant orders against operational requisitions including the collation of all contractual documentation, logging and maintenance of orders. <\u002Fp>\n      <p>This is a key role where you will be responsible for the administration of sub-contractor details including pre-qualification questionnaires, performance data and input of information to the database.<br> <br> <\u002Fp>\n      <p><b>You’ll:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Look to minimise the cost of materials and plant supplied to Skanska as well as improve service level agreements with suppliers and internal departments.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful> \n      <ul>\n       <li> Participate in the implementation of strategic procedural and practical changes to increase productivity and performance and drive compliance with Skanska Procedures and policy on procurement including participation in Audits (Internal\u002FExternal).<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful> \n      <ul>\n       <li> Assist the Procurement Manager in preparation of enquiry documents and tender review sheets.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful> \n      <ul>\n       <li> Obtain quotations for materials and plant to tight deadlines to meet tender return dates.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful> \n      <ul>\n       <li> Raise orders ensuring relevant technical and commercial clauses are included.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful> \n      <ul>\n       <li> Participate in Category Agreement Teams.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b>We are looking for:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Degree level education, or qualified by experience.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful> \n      <ul>\n       <li> Ideally, membership of professional body (RICS, CIPS), or working towards.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful> \n      <ul>\n       <li> Demonstrable experience of procurement in the construction industry.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful> \n      <ul>\n       <li> Sound working knowledge of the main forms of contract, NEC, JCT, CECA (ICE).<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful> \n      <ul>\n       <li> Knowledge of the forms of sub-contract for the building, civils and utilities sectors.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful> \n      <ul>\n       <li> Experience of negotiating with suppliers.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful> \n      <ul>\n       <li> Ability to prioritise workload and work to deadlines.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful> \n      <ul>\n       <li> Computer literate (use of excel and word) and Multiple Purchasing systems.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>A career with us means you’ll have the freedom to develop your skills and leave your mark on the communities in which we work. Our competitive benefits package will help to enhance your life outside work, too.<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>Equal opportunities:<\u002Fp> \n      <p>We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation, and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>Flexible working:<\u002Fp> \n      <p>We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>Reasonable adjustments:<\u002Fp> \n      <p>We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. project development and construction groups, is an inclusive and responsible business that is helping to build a better society.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Skanska is the Delivery Integration Partner (DIP) on Highways England's Regional Development Partnership (RDP) Framework within the Midlands and East Regions<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> About the project: <\u002Fb>A428 Black Cat to Caxton Gibbet Improvement scheme<\u002Fp>\n      <p> The purpose of the Scheme is to address the problems of congestion, poor journey time reliability and poor resilience against incidents between the Black Cat and Caxton Gibbet roundabouts. The Scheme seeks to address these problems through the construction of a new 10 mile dual 2-lane carriageway from west of the A421 \u002F A1 Black Cat roundabout through to east of the A428\u002FA1198 Caxton Gibbet roundabout.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced safety professional to work in a collaborative environment influencing and leading on all aspects of health and safety performance.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> You Will:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul> \n       <li>Advise, guide and coach all personnel on the project with the implementation of the Health &amp; Safety Management System that is OWOW.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Understand the Company Health &amp; Safety and wellbeing Policies and Procedures and statutory requirements as they affect the Project operations and ensure that the requirements are implemented.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist the Project Manager or Project SHW Manager in preparing and developing the Project Construction Phase Health &amp; Safety Plan &amp; coordinate reviews as required.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Lead when required on entries and closing out of project incidents on OSHENS (Skanska reporting database).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Undertake site SHW inspections as required. Participate as requested in “Company” SHW Audit and inspections. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Assist in the investigation of accidents, incidents, dangerous occurrences, near misses and other incidents where appropriate. Monitor and coordinate the close out of the above.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <br> \n      <p><b>We’re looking For:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><br> Relevant SHW experiences within construction is desirable but not exclusive to construction, a similar high-risk industry would be considered<\u002Fli>\n       <li> NEBOSH diploma or NVQ level 5 or above in Occupational Health &amp; Safety if not obtained working towards<\u002Fli> \n       <li>NEBOSH Construction Certificate or NEBOSH General certificate or equivalent NVQ<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Tech IOSH or AIEMA or equivalent and working towards Chartered membership <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Previous Highways construction environment experience desirable<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Driving Licence<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n      <p><b>Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p>Skanska, a leading construction company and developer, is an inclusive and responsible business that is helping to build a better society. Known for many major projects, we are creating, upgrading and maintaining the country’s buildings and infrastructure. Drawing on our Scandinavian heritage, we are green, innovative and progressive. We bring together people and technology, helping to make our industry safer and more collaborative. <\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p>Our infrastructure team brings its design, build and refurbishment expertise to complex projects across the country. We form strong partnerships with clients and communities to deliver major infrastructure improvements like Crossrail, HS2, A14 and the M25 widening. <\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p>As Works Manager you will ensure the efficient and effective management of all operational activities on the project ensuring HSQE, programme and budget requirements are met. Moreover, ensure effective communication and engagement with all members of the workforce, review and address competency challenges. Additionally, the successful candidate will work closely with the Project Director and Senior leadership Team to promote and support improvement initiatives and campaigns.<br> <\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>You Will: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Ensure the coordination of and communication between all parts of the operation team including supply chain, Skanska enabling teams and the clients’ representatives. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ensure competency of all members of the workforce but specifically own the Front-Line Supervisor (FLS) assessment process. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Build and develop the FLS team to deliver all aspects of the project requirements; identify training requirements, regular review performance and ensure corrective actions implemented. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Build value adding relationships with all sub-contractors and suppliers' management teams that will ensure project objectives are met. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ensure high standard of quality on the works to meet the specification requirements ‘first time’ and minimise rework. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Assist delivery teams with development of working method and outputs for production of method statements and programme. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ensure FLS team maintain exemplary records and provide in a timely manner. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Champion the use of best practice permit systems specifically related to breaking ground – promote and achieve full compliance <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Carry out regular safety and environmental engagement tours and implement recommended courses of action as identified from progress monitoring and management inspections. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Deliver regular all team briefings and ensure climate surveys are undertaken periodically to establish the project culture. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Lead by example regarding collaborative behaviours – ensure you are class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p><b>Job Description <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p>SCS Railways are creating an exemplar site to showcase construction methods, training, technology and equipment, demonstrating best practice and innovation across our strategic priorities. The gateway to our industry leading facility will be the ‘Welcome Centre’, an inviting and modern space to host new staff, visitors and training candidates for their onward journey to the Induction and Visitor Centre, Training Academy and ‘Breathe’ our dedicated tunnel safety training suite. Fundamental to the success of these combined operations, the successful candidate will be approachable, a team player and must have excellent communication skills to assist in liaising with our staff, sub-contractors and visitors.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Main Responsibilities <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Administration in relation to the access control uploading and verifying documents <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Managing the induction day for the project <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Troubleshooting with supply chain organizational administrators <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Maintaining the induction email box daily <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Verifications and checking of profiles for induction <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Action vetting clearance emails <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Maintain all induction processes via the Engage process and create the documents <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Maintain the procurement approval process before adding a new supply chain to the system <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Briefing and guidance to the project team, subcontractors, suppliers and 3rd parties on any developments to the system <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Representing SCS to ensure that the joint venture’s interests and commitment for security and safety are aligned with their needs <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Reporting any breaches or abuse of the system and escalation to the Security Systems Manager <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Driving innovation and the upskilling of the project team in all security systems matters and continuous improvement <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Support the wider Health Safety and Security team in the rollout of specific Health and Safety briefings and behavioral change program ‘Love for Life’ <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b>The Ideal Candidate <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p>Essential Qualifications &amp; Skills:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Excellent communication and interpersonal skills <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Experience in working within a fast paced environment and team <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Experience as a systems coordinator or similar role <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Knowledge of competency management systems <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Good knowledge of data privacy law and GDPR <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <b>Desirable Qualifications &amp; Skills:<\u002Fb>\n      <br> \n      <ul>\n       <li> Experience on a similar size construction project <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Experience in management systems <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Knowledge of induction process and procedures <\u002Fli>\n       <li>People\u002FSystems related skills<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. by the Lead Engineer\u002F Managers in support of the maintenance of the site under the terms of the Bristol Schools PFI contract.<\u002Fp>\n       <p> <b>You’ll:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p>SCS IT Team is responsible for managing cloud-based services and on-site facilities for about 2000 users. Our services are SaaS by Construction related solution providers, and our effort is towards ensuring business requirements and service levels are met; aligned to collaborative delivery of technology solutions.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> We are looking at enhancing our capability and performance by onboarding a hands-on Support Service desk resource looking after the first line support for IT core services (O365 administration, Onboarding, Offboarding, Exchange etcetera) and support with other construction specific systems and projects as and when required (adequate training will be provided). The role is process and information driven and will be leveraged by the current ITSM system and the relevant application business owners.<br> <\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>Main Responsibilities <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Understanding, and administering the SCS JV Office 365 tenant, including user administration, Azure active directory, exchange administration including user mail boxes, whitelisting, blacklisting, share mail boxes and resource mail boxes. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Responsible for the creation of Office 365 Groups, including mail enabled security groups and email distribution groups. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Responsible for level 1 support, including incident management and the restoration of service to the SCS JV user base. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Responsible for the end to end JML (Joiner’s, Mover’s and Leaver’s) process, including the onboarding and offboarding of SCS staff and the Supply Chain. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>An understanding of Sharepoint, and MS Teams, and the relevant permission structures around the use of both tools. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Responsible for the request fulfilment of service requests within the SCS JV. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Understanding of and assistance to the Change management process. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Authoring of documentation\u002Ftraining material for both IT and business and input into the knowledge management process. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ability to travel to the various SCS JV sites as and when required. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Troubleshooting parent company support tasks as and when required. <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b>The Ideal Candidate <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Experience with Microsoft365 administration. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>At least 3 years experience within an IT Service desk. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Experience working within IT support for the construction industry preferable. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>ITIL V3 foundation preferable, or experience with ITIL Transition, Incident management and Change management disciplines. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Experience with direct printing. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ability to work independently without much supervision. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Team player. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ability to think laterally and outside of the box to find solutions. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ability to liaise with people on both a technical and non-technical level <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Good communication and outstanding customer service skills <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ability to be dynamic, self-motivated and work on own using own initiative is essential Equal opportunities<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams.  Project Management \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <b>External closing date: <\u002Fb>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      Tuesday, February 28, 2023 \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <b>Type of contract: <\u002Fb>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      Permanent \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <b>ID: <\u002Fb>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      2407 \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p><b>Graduate Design Engineer - Development Programme 2023 (Bridgend)<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We are looking for a graduate Design Engineer to join our 2023 development programme and help us shape the future of Skanska Technology (ST)<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> The Opportunity:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Skanska Technology provides a diverse mix of professional services including civil engineering, structural engineering, infrastructure design, green consultancy, project management services, air quality consultancy, Modern Methods of Construction (MMC) consultancy and noise and vibration advisory services.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> The industry is modernising and so are we. We invite applications from passionate free thinkers who aren’t constrained by how things are currently done and can bring a fresh perspective to our business.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> In return, Skanska can provide a great foundation on which to build your career with us: we will help you develop your technical skills by working alongside, and being mentored by, our technical experts working on some of the most challenging projects in the UK.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> The diversity of our projects will also equip you with wide-ranging skills you need in this exciting industry. A snapshot of our current projects include:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> civil engineering design on HS2<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> structural engineering advice on major infrastructure projects such as the Lower Thames Crossing<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> designing schools and colleges for the Department for Education Framework<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> providing green consultancy and carbon reduction advice for major projects in the rail and water sectors<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> designing water treatment facilities for Anglian Water<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> designing steel plants or major electrical substations for some of our external clients.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> Our two-year graduate programme will allow you to work with staff from other parts of Skanska to solve a range of business critical challenges, allowing you to develop your business skills in parallel with your technical skills and build a professional network to carry into your future career with Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> You will also join our ICE approved training scheme and will be supported and mentored in your professional development by our in house Supervising Civil Engineers.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> In combination, we will equip you with the technical skills, business skills, guidance, and mentor support to achieve your full potential and to become a professionally qualified Civil Engineer.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Location(s):<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Bridgend, South Wales: <\u002Fb>Our modern offices conveniently located at Junction 35 of the M4. Close to Cardiff, Swansea, and the beaches and mountains of South Wales.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> What you’ll do:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Further develop your civil and structural engineering design skills in relation to elements in structural steelwork, reinforced concrete, masonry, and timber<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Develop skills in the use of engineering and design software such as SCIA 3D, Autodesk Robot Professional, STAAD Pro, WALLAP, TEDDS, and other packages.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Obtain a good working knowledge of UK standards, specifications and best practice. We will build upon the skills you have developed in your undergraduate study and develop these in the use of the Eurocode suite of Standards. You will also develop knowledge of sector specific best practice \u002F specifications such as CESWI, or the Design Manual for roads and Bridges.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Be responsible for assisting senior members of the team to deliver technical design information including reports, models and drawings and specifications for Civil and Structural Engineering projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Improve your digital engineering skills, and work with our team of BIM technicians to prepare accurate 3D models for our construction projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Ensure that your work in the team complies with current legislation, the Skanska Integrated Management System, the Skanska Code of Conduct and industry best practice.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Who you are:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Studying towards or having completed a Civil Engineering degree, accredited by ICE<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> You will have an appreciation and knowledge of the engineering principles that lie behind civil and structural engineering design<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Ability to communicate new concepts and ideas to both technical and non-technical colleagues<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Basic knowledge of software relevant to design in the civil and structural engineering field as noted previously.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Appreciation and basic competence in the use of the Eurocode suite of design standards would be an advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Values driven and passionate about sustainability<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Keen desire to learn<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> What we offer:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> The opportunity to work on technically challenging projects, to maximise your development.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> A place on our industry leading Graduate Passport to build your business skills and corporate network.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> A supportive working environment with access to technical mentors, and a number of in-house SCE’s to support you with attainment of professional qualifications.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> A competitive reward package including a company car or travel allowance, where appropriate.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> An inclusive work environment where everyone is encouraged to be ‘their whole self’.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> Skanska is one of the world’s leading project development and construction groups and is an inclusive and responsible business that is helping to build a better society.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Drawing on our Scandinavian heritage, we are green, innovative, and progressive. We bring together people and technology, as part of our objective to make construction a safer and more collaborative industry.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> At Skanska, we believe in our Purpose: we build for a better society. Through our Values of care for life, commit to customers, be better – together, and act ethically and transparently you will enable us to deliver our Purpose.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Start date<\u002Fb>: September 2023<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Application deadline: <\u002Fb>28th February 2023<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. Please contact us using emerging.talent@skanska.co.uk if you require any adjustments that would support you throughout your application.<\u002Fp>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p>Our UK-wide building team has built a reputation for high quality offices in Commercial and Mixed-used developments, Healthcare, Custodial, Defence, and Education. Our award-winning projects include 52 Lime Street, 30 St Mary Axe, Bristol Schools, St Bartholomew and the Royal London Hospitals to name a few.<br> <br> We are currently looking for a Health &amp; Safety Advisor to provide guidance and coaching to Project Teams. The role will involve supporting multiple different projects on a when require basis to assist the resident H&amp;S Managers<br> <br> The purpose of this role is to provide functional Health &amp; Safety advice, guidance and coaching to Project Teams.<br> <br> This is a key position to support the Project H&amp;S Manager \u002F Director in establishing and maintaining the highest Health and Safety standards for the project. The role will involve supporting multiple different projects on a when require basis to assist the resident H&amp;S Managers.<br> <br> You Will:<\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li> Advise, guide and coach all personnel on the project with the implementation of the Health &amp; Safety Management System (HSMS)<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Be responsible to the Project Manager \u002F Director for maintaining the Health &amp; Safety competence matrix<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Support the Project Manager \u002F Director in the production, review and implementation of the Construction Phase Plan \u002F Project Execution Plan<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Monitor the project, trade contractors, designers, suppliers and assisting the Procurement Team<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Liaise with trade contractors, designers, suppliers, client, enforcement agencies and other relevant parties<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Support the business to win work. When directed complete Pre-Qualification Questionnaires (PQQ) and tender enquiries.<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p><br> <br> We’re Looking for:<\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li> Previous experience in relevant field of Construction (multi-storey large commercial and mixed use projects, schools etc)<\u002Fli>\n        <li> NEBOSH Construction Certificate<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Technician grade membership of IOSH (Tech IOSH) or above<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Working towards chartered membership of IOSH – CMIOSH<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p> Please note, this will be roaming role that may occasionally require some overnight stays.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. the bid and the ongoing management of all design related issues until project completion.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> You will: <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Assist design complies with Client brief, contract, legislation, town planning, building regulations, CDM and technical requirements<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure that all responsibilities under CDM regulations are maintained<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure any design derogations are included in the contract<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p> We’re looking for: <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n for a Senior Project Manager to join the team on-site at on one of our Bristol MEP Projects. <\u002Fp>\n      <p>The purpose of the role will be to Effectively and professionally lead the day-to-day operational management on projects, including, design, procurement, installation, logistics, compliance, commissioning and project handover. Delivering within budget and programme to the satisfaction of the client.<br> <\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p>Skanska, one of the world’s largest development and construction companies, dates back 135 years and had a 2021 revenue of around £12.5 billion. We have 3,300 experts in the UK alone, could joining us be your next career move?<br> <\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p>You’ll:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Engineering and Construction<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensures full compliance of design, engineering, construction and commissioning processes.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Add value to the design process by challenging solutions, methods and techniques where appropriate to deliver works within the contract programme, improve build ability and reduce whole life costs.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Project Process Control<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Develop and administer controls on the project or workplace and ensures full implementation and compliance.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Leads lessons learnt and collates for future projects.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Planning and Programming<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Understand\u002F develop\u002F scrutinise\u002F deliver\u002F monitor end to end programme. Set milestones and key deliverables. Lead the implementation of overall project plan. Responsible for creating Plan B.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Commercial<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Active control of commercial and contractual aspects applicable to project. Input and ability to scrutinise financial forecasting and CVR. Create and manage profit improvement plans for the project.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Conditions of Contract<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Full understanding and implementation of the contract and the conditions imposed ensuring full compliance at all stages.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Risk and Opportunity Management<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Oversee, manage, implement and communicate Risk mitigation and steps needed to pursue Opportunities. Ensure that the commercial implications are controlled, allocated and Communicated.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Quality Management<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Live project quality plan in full compliance with company processes. Full understanding of all the processes and analyse the outputs and recognise trends, implement corrective actions. Monitor and record all quality metrics in accordance with corporate governance.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Health, Safety and Environment<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Implementing, managing, recording and reporting in full accordance with the HSE management systems in place. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Promote the Skanska safety culture and comply with all relevant safety systems and processes.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Tendering and Procurement<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Compile tender submissions and fully control the process to achieve sign off from SLT. Fully articulate the risk profile, form of contract, budget, opportunities and route to margin. Scrutinise supply chain submissions with full awareness of the procurement strategy. Ensuring T&amp;Cs are back-to-back with Skanska.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> BIM, Design and Digitalisation<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Project specific BEP, DFMa strategy and strategic use of technology available in maximising the use of digitalisation<\u002Fli>\n       <li> People Management<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake line management responsibilities for direct and indirect employees.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Manage performance through coaching and feedback and undertaking the annual performance review process.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Manage talent by actively developing other team members using knowledge and experience, through encouragement and support.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Champion and support people related initiatives, i.e. employee engagement, diversity and inclusion<br> <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p>We’re looking for: <\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Appropriate knowledge and experience to manage multiple disciplines\u002Finterfaces and work sequencing. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Proven track record in successfully delivering large scale MEP contracts <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Formal H&amp;S training accreditations, minimum SMSTS <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Proven track record in leading teams and projects <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Experience and Knowledge in relation to the correct testing and commissioning of a complete MEPH installation <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b>Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. looking for a Senior Project Manager for DFE, this is a key role where you will effectively and professionally lead day to day Design and Construction management of significant elements on of a DFE project, including procurement, installation, and commissioning. You will also be expected to deliver within budget and programme to the satisfaction of the client, users, and local community.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> You will:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Lead the management of design consultants to ensure information is provide to suit the procurement strategy, manage the production of working drawings by trade contractors within the given timeframes<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Oversee all works of the trade contractors, contributing to the selection of key specialists, suppliers, productions including the production of working drawings, procurement and prefabrication and performance on site.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Develop clear, detailed and practical measures of performance to meet project objectives. Regularly inspect works for compliance with design and report on progress, ensuring remedial action is taken within agreed timelines<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Lead the management of design consultants to ensure information is provided to suit the budget and procurement strategy, manage the production of working drawings by trade contractors within the given timeframes<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure design solutions offered by designers and trade contractors fully comply with the project documentation within the given timeframes. Add value to the design development process by challenging solutions and methods.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake line management responsibilities for direct report staff ensuring each is effectively managed, had a current performance review and learning plan,<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p> We’re looking for: <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Demonstrable experience as a Project Manager<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Main contractor experience <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Working knowledge of materials, specification and industry working practices<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Background working on DFE\u002FEducation projects <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Educated to HNC level of equivalent essential<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Likely to hold professional qualification (MCIOB)<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Enhanced DBS certificate will be required<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p><b>Graduate Quantity Surveyor – Development programme 2023 - Peterborough<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> Skanska Group uses knowledge and foresight to shape the way people live, work and connect. More than 135 years in the making, we are one of the world’s largest development and construction companies. We create innovative and sustainable solutions that support healthy living beyond our lifetime. Established in the UK in 2000, Skanska has more than 3,300 local experts delivering projects across sectors including real estate, defence, education, highways, rail and water.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> Anglian Water @one Alliance is a collaborative organisation made up of our seven partner companies (Anglian Water, Balfour Beatty, Barhale, MMB, MWH Treatment, Skanska and SWECO) and our extended supply chain, delivering over half of Anglian Water’s capital investment programme.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> With a variety of challenging and complex projects, it is essential we implement the most innovative and pro-active commercial practices possible, providing an industry-leading end-to-end Commercial facility across the @one alliance. With this in mind, we are looking for a Commercial Graduate to join us on our exciting journey and contribute to our future success!<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> As our new Commercial Graduate, you’ll act as the commercial conscious to the integrated delivery team, providing commercial support to both the delivery management and on-site delivery teams. Embracing the outperformance mentality, you’ll ensure that operations are carried out to control costs, maximising value, minimising future liabilities, and maintaining the required standard of quality and safety.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> What you’ll do:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p><br> Assist the programme area Estimating team to ensure robust estimates are provided that align to scope and make allowance for risks and opportunities including any necessary analysis, transfer of data to Alliance Procurement system and Cost Base<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Work closely with the Quantity Surveyor, Procurement team, Construction Manager and Project Delivery Manager in preparing Subcontracts and procurement strategies and ensuring they reflect agreed scope<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Produce accurate live forecasting, considering the programme and reporting in accordance with the respective work breakdown structure \u002F cost breakdown structure<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Ensure actual costs are monitored and assessed against baseline, value of work done, solution cost progress, affordability challenges and final outturn calculations<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Provide reports on actual costs vs. estimate &amp; identifying underlying reasons for any variance &amp; resolutions, highlight, challenge &amp; resolve variance to latest plans<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Assist the Quantity Surveyor in ensuring that all project team members (including site staff) understand the contractual arrangements, in order to satisfy Client &amp; Partner organisation requirements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Ensure that proper records are kept &amp; maintained so financial information for audits and cost assurance is readily available<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Who you are:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Studying towards (in your final year) or having completed a Quantity Surveying degree accredited by the RICS. We will consider applications from other commercially focused or construction qualification backgrounds.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Have excellent communications skills and attention to detail<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Commercially minded<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Enthusiastic about learning and developing new ways of thinking<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> What we offer:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p><br> Clear learning and development opportunities to build your knowledge, skills, and behaviours to prepare you for your career at Skanska beyond the graduate programme<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Support and guidance from experienced commercial teams<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Professional and social networks<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> The opportunity to work towards membership of your chosen professional body<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Project management and leadership development mentoring<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Opportunities to volunteer at least one day per year<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Competitive benefits package<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Skanska graduate programme<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> The two-year graduate programme provides a pathway to develop a complete skill set, developing both technical and interpersonal skills. The programme includes interesting courses and on-the-job learning.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> As part of the graduate programme, teams will embark on projects to solve business challenges. These projects provide exposure to graduates and senior colleagues in the company and build a strong professional network whilst improving the business.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Programme start date: <\u002Fb>September 2023<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Location: <\u002Fb>You will be based in our office in Peterborough<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. Please contact us using <b>emerging.talent@skanska.co.uk<\u002Fb> if you require any adjustments that would support you throughout your application.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> More information about the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Please note this is an advert for our job vacancy, and therefore may not be inclusive of all assigned duties, responsibilities, or aspects of the role described, and may be amended at any time at the sole discretion of Skanska. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p>Our UK Facility Management Team are specialise in hard FM services, Capital Maintenance and Replacement schemes across several sectors such as Healthcare, MOD and Commercial.<\u002Fp> \n       <p>We are now looking to add to our successful team with an Environmental Advisor, to support and assist the Operating Unit Environmental Manager in the delivery of the Skanska UK and OU environment strategies, objectives and targets. The role will be responsible for supporting and advising on a range of projects and contracts teams in their delivery of environmental legislative and contractual requirements, in line with Skanska’s and the clients’ standards. This role is based in our Northwood HQ with travel required across a number of our sites across London and Regions<\u002Fp> \n       <p>You will: <\u002Fp>\n       <p><\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li>Manage the investigation and close-out of environmental near misses and incidents.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Support operational teams and subcontractors in identifying environmental risks and in embedding environmental controls into projects and activities.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Support operational teams, subcontractors and clients in identifying environmental opportunities and solutions and in implementing these where practical, and assist all parties in understanding the benefits of such interventions.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Deliver environmental training courses, toolbox talks (TBTs) and briefing sessions to internal and external parties in line with Skanska requirements e.g. site teams, supply chain, customer.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Develop, maintain, implement and coordinate the review of all Environmental Management System (EMS) documentation at project\u002Fcontract level.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Contribute to work-winning activities by seeking, writing, and reviewing environmental evidence in tenders, bids, and mobilisations.<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful> \n       <p>We’re looking for: <\u002Fp>\n       <p><\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li>Degree level   <div>\n    <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p>Skanska, a leading construction company and developer, is an inclusive and responsible business that is helping to build a better society. Known for many major projects, we are creating, upgrading and maintaining the country’s buildings and infrastructure. Drawing on our Scandinavian heritage, we are green, innovative, and progressive. We bring together people and technology, helping to make our industry safer and more collaborative.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> Our infrastructure team brings its design, build and refurbishment expertise to complex projects across the country. We form strong partnerships with clients and communities to deliver major infrastructure improvements like Crossrail, HS2, A14 and the M25 widening.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> As Procurement Manager you will support and develop the project procurement function, including the development and implementation of project procurement strategies, to successfully procure the relevant trade contract packages, goods and services, to meet the needs of the project under the direction of the project procurement lead.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> You Will:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul> \n       <li>Participate in the implementation of strategic procedural and practical changes to increase productivity and performance.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepare sub-contract enquiry documents and tender review sheets. Obtaining quotations for subcontract packages<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Implement and enforce compliance of all procurement team activities with the approved business processes and procedures<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work within a multi-disciplined team<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Manage, monitor and report on project procurement schedules<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Manage, monitor and report on costs versus budget tender situations<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Manage supply chain and recommend improvements and efficiencies<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Manage process and programme for major materials and plant procurement exercises, including ownership of relevant procurement documentation<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Utilise expertise within the plant and materials market to mitigate supply risk to scheme delivery<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p>We're Looking For:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul> \n       <li>Experience of procurement management on significant contracts<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ideally, membership of professional body (RICS, CIPS), or working towards.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Previous experience as a Buyer\u002FSenior Buyer ideally from a similar background or industry (Construction)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Working knowledge of main contract T’s &amp; C’s and also CPA and RPA conditions<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience of ERP systems<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. Please contact us using <b>recruitment@skanska.co.uk<\u002Fb> if you require any adjustments that would support you throughout your application.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> More information about the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Please note this is an advert for our job vacancy, and therefore may not be inclusive of all assigned duties, responsibilities, or aspects of the role described, and may be amended at any time at the sole discretion of Skanska. Introduction<\u002Fp>\n        <p> The SCSJV IT Team is responsible for managing cloud-based services and on-site facilities for about around 2000 users, across 20 locations between Euston and West Ruislip.<br> <br> The majority of our services are SaaS by Construction related solution providers, and our effort is towards ensuring business requirements and service levels are met. But we have also Azure hosted and third-party managed applications which requires care and attention to meet our service level business expectation.<\u002Fp>\n        <p> As part of the effort for managing cloud infrastructure, and some minor on-prem, the IT team is looking for a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer to increase their capacity and expertise.<\u002Fp>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <p> Main Responsibilities<\u002Fp>\n        <ul>\n         <li> Reporting directly to the Head of IT Operations, the Cloud Infrastructure Engineer is responsible for administering internal Azure services.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Instrumental in the installation and upkeep of operating systems, network or application software in the SCS Azure environment.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Sitting on the Technical Design Authority, the Cloud Infrastructure engineer will have a critical role in reviewing technical designs for system implementations, integrations and proposed changes to systems.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Provide technical guidance or support for the troubleshooting of systems and to maintain a detailed understanding of the implemented technology used in SCS Railways.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> liaise with the rest of the IT Team to ensure their capability to resolve issues and avoid future problems and facilitating the development of new documentation and insights.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Mentor \u002F develop IT colleagues in system operation and or maintenance of internal cloud systems<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Assist in the technical implementation of new technology solutions and drawing on the expertise of IT colleagues in respect of the user liaison and rollout, always working towards a co-ordinated approach to technical project execution. Ensure appropriate liaison and\u002For consultation has been undertaken with both colleagues and external suppliers or consultants to ensure the success of the project<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Maintains knowledge of industry trends, new technologies and considers how these might be applicable to SCS Railways.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Work closely with our partners to control the IT services to ensure optimal operational status (job scheduling, backup, routine maintenance, patching, upgrades, resource monitoring).<\u002Fli>\n        <\u002Ful>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <p> The Ideal Candidate<\u002Fp>\n        <ul>\n         <li> 3+ years of experience implementing and supporting services in Azure<\u002Fli>\n         <li> High-level of system administration experience critical<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Organised, meticulous and methodical - Process Orientated<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Microsoft AZ-204 Azure Developer Associate<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Strong knowledge and experience with information technology platforms: Office 365, Azure, Active Directory, Exchange, SharePoint.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Strong analytical skills<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Ability to work on own initiative and within a collaborative team environment<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Excellent oral and written communication<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Ability to remain calm and adaptable under pressure and manage workload and<br> time in a fast paced, quick changing environment<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Experience of Administration through automation using Powershell<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Ability to handle basic Microsoft SQL administration \u002F maintenance tasks<\u002Fli>\n        <\u002Ful>\n        <p> Desirable:<\u002Fp>\n        <ul>\n         <li> Certification: Microsoft AZ-104 Azure Administrator Associate<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Certification: Microsoft AZ-900 Azure Fundamentals<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Familiar in ITIL service management usage or equivalent operational framework<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Familiar with Cyber and Information Security standards and requirements (EU and UK).<\u002Fli>\n        <\u002Ful>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. Please contact us using <b>recruitment@skanska.co.uk<\u002Fb> if you require any adjustments that would support you throughout your application.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> More information about the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> Please note this is an advert for our job vacancy, and therefore may not be inclusive of all assigned duties, responsibilities, or aspects of the role described, and may be amended at any time at the sole discretion of Skanska.
