Skanska Costain STRABAG joint venture team is working in partnership with HS2 to deliver the new London tunnels from Euston to West Ruislip. Our joint venture team is working on sites at Euston, Old Oak Common and West Ruislip, building tunnels 13 miles long and up to 50m deep, supporting delivery of HS2 phase one.<\u002Fp>\n       <p> We are looking for a <b>Technical Assurance Manager <\u002Fb>to join our <b>HS2<\u002Fb> team onsite in<b> London<\u002Fb>. You will be responsible for ensuring demonstrating that the works carried out by the Skanska Costain STRABAG Joint Venture (SCS JV) meet the Client (HS2) requirements as set out in the Works Information and Technical Requirements documentation.. <\u002Fp>\n       <p><b>Responsibilities<\u002Fb>: <\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li>To support the Head of Technical Assurance in the development and implementation of the Technical Assurance Strategy, plans, processes and systems within the project.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Provide narrative reports and metrics against TA KPI targets; progressive technical assurance activities; Certification and Sign off Status.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Undertake activities as defined in the project Plans and Procedures in liaison with those delivering the works. The activities will include monitoring progress of works, reviewing deliverables for evidence of compliance, raising issues \u002F non-conformances where appropriate and negotiating corrective actions with those responsible for the works<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Coordinate the certification activities for work packages to gain L3 certification from the Employer<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p><b> Skills and Qualifications<\u002Fb>: <\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li>Significant experience of working at equivalent level in a project environment<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Capable of developing plans and managing workload \u002F activities and taking sole accountability for task delivery<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Able to show resilience and tenacity whilst remaining adaptable and flexible when working under the pressure of tight deadlines and project change<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Awareness of the various disciplines involved in delivering major projects, their roles and responsibilities and their relationship to assurance<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Good information management and analytical skills, able to quickly and efficiently seek out the relevant and pertinent points from large volumes of project information<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p><b>Job Description <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p>This role is responsible for developing and delivering complete and comprehensive processes and products for the project Asset Data Information Model (AIM), for all SCS JV Work Packages, based on the Project Information Model (PIM) and under the scope of Engineering Design and Construction, Asset Operation and Maintenance, Health and Safety and Carbon Management.<br> <\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>Main Responsibilities <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Developing and managing the Asset Information Model, assuring and reporting the AIM quality, integrity and compliance against the Employer Information Requirements, the HS2 Asset Integrity Management System (AIMS), the SCS JV BIM Execution Plan, the SCS JV Content Plan, the SCS JV HS2 Asset Classes Matrix, the SCS JV Asset List and PAS1192. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Supporting the Asset Information Systems Manager on maintaining the SCS JV Asset Information Model Database. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Deploying SCS JV AIMS Enable My Team (EMT) and AssetWise to generate Asset Data Associations and Families to feed the HS2 AIMS system.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Responsible for reviewing and updating as required, and in close collaboration with the BIM Leads, the SCS JV Content Plan, the SCS JV HS2 Asset Classes Matrix and the SCS JV Asset Lists. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Responsible for the review of the HS2 Asset Data Dictionary Definition Document (AD4) and the corresponding change control process. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>This will involve the supervision of the identification of entity changes and implement, if necessary, any required amendments to the SCS JV AIM <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Responsible to communicate to all SCS JV BIM Leads any proposed changes on the HS2 AD4 and collaborate closely with them to agree if changes should and could be implemented.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Working closely to the HS2 Asset Information Lead counterpart and communicate any recommendations or comments that SCS JV might have on the HS2 Asset Information Model proposals, deriving from the HS2 AD4 documents. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Responsible to liaise with the Project Controls, Health and Safety, Planning, Estimating, and Environmental teams to ensure Asset Data integration, suitability and that the SCS JV Asset Information Model is an amalgamation of all available project data. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Responsible to ensure that the Supply Chain AIM Model fulfills the purpose and the scope as intended and complies with the SCS JV CIR. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Run Project Asset Data Information Modelling Clinic’s to enable the Contractor and the Supply Chain to deliver their Asset Information Models more effectively and in compliance with the project standards. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Supporting the Head of BIM on the development and updating of the BIM Execution Plan and the Contractor Information Requirements in relation to the SCS JV Asset Information Model across all Work Packages. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Understand the Client and Joint Venture Partners' Environment and Sustainability Policies, Processes and statutory requirements as they affect the company's operations and ensure that the requirements, as applicable within their discipline, are implemented on the project. <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b>The Ideal Candidate <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Previous experience as an Asset Information Lead or Coordinator, working across all stages of a Civil Engineering project lifecycle. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Solid understanding of the BIM Development and Implementation in conjunction to the Engineering Design, Construction, Operation and Maintenance phases. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Experience on working within and managing Asset Data Management Environments and Systems from a Data Management role. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Experience of working within project environments.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Desirable:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Solid understanding of PAS 1192 suite of documents. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Knowledge of SQL Language coding and SQL Database management. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Knowledge of Extract-Transform-Load Process and particularly FME. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>High-Level Awareness of APIs and Systems integration. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Sustained Continuing Professional Development. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>A highly ambitious individual with a drive to succeed. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Degree or equivalent in civil engineering or an appropriate professional qualification<b>.<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. Please contact us using <b>recruitment@skanska.co.uk<\u002Fb> if you require any adjustments that would support you throughout your application.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> More information about the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Please note this is an advert for our job vacancy, and therefore may not be inclusive of all assigned duties, responsibilities, or aspects of the role described, and may be amended at any time at the sole discretion of Skanska. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p>Our UK-wide building team has built a reputation for high quality offices in Commercial and Mixed-used developments, Healthcare, Custodial, Defence, and Education. Our award-winning projects include 52 Lime Street (The Scalpel), 30 St Mary Axe(The Gherkin), Bristol Schools, St Bartholomew and the Royal London Hospitals to name a few.<\u002Fp>\n       <p> To build on our success we are looking to add a Senior Project Manager to effectively and professionally lead day to day design and construction management of significant elements on one of our large-scale projects based in London.<\u002Fp>\n       <p> This is a key role which involves overseeing the procurement, installation, and commissioning phases with a need for someone with experience of large Commercial \u002F Mixed-Use project experience.<\u002Fp>\n       <p> You Will:<\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li> Familiarise and understand the contract programme and the mode and method strategy.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Represent the company at meetings, promote the correct company image and ensure staff are aware of their responsibilities in this area<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Lead the management of design consultants to ensure information is provide to suit the procurement strategy, manage the production of working drawings by trade contractors within the given timeframes<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Oversee all works of the trade contractors, contributing to the selection of key specialists, suppliers, productions including the production of working drawings, procurement and prefabrication and performance on site.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Ensure design solutions offered by designers and trade contractors fully comply with the project documentation within the given timeframes. Add value to the design development process by challenging solutions and methods.<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p> We’re Looking For:<\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li> Extensive knowledge\u002Fexperience of the successful delivery of Commercial\u002FMixed-Use building projects of 75 million plus.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Demonstrable building sector experience as a Senior\u002FProject Manager or major build projects.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Key understanding of programme and the importance of sequence within the Commercial\u002FMixed Use sector.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Demonstrable experience managing and leading a team at delivery phase.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Educated to HNC level of equivalent essential<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Likely to hold professional qualification (MCIOB)<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p>Our UK-wide building team has built a reputation for delivering high quality projects in Commercial and Mixed-used developments, Healthcare, Custodial, Education and Defence Sectors.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> To build on the continued success and partnership we enjoy with one of our key clients - the Defence Infrastructure Organisation (DIO), we are seeking a Design Manager with defence experience to support the management of the interface between the Client, design team, project construction team and specialist sub-contractor design teams from bid through to delivery stage.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> This is a key role in which you will work with the Senior Design Manager to drive a collaborative approach between client and Skanska to ensure the best outcome for all parties.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> You’ll<\u002Fp>\n      <ul> \n       <li>Interrogate design brief and tender information, identify and manage the design risks, identify and manage opportunities.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Co-ordinate the completion and maintenance of a design management plan in conjunction with the overall construction programme.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Help manage the flow of information in conjunction with document controller, whilst ensuring the maintenance of all records.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Participate in value engineering and construction methodology reviews. Ensure all responsibilities under CDM legislation are identified, assigned and maintained.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ensure that project design complies with the brief, contract, employer’s requirements, building control, and where appropriate, Town Planning legislation and Conditions..<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p>We're looking for<\u002Fp>\n      <ul> \n       <li>Experience of working on large building projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Able to obtain necessary security clearances to work on UK defence projects and government bodies.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Experience of supporting projects from bid through to delivery stage.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Understanding of BIM in design and construction phases.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to interrogate construction detailing\u002F building methodology<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience of managing a team(s).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Preferable to hold relevant professional qualification in a related subject.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p>Skanska, a leading construction company and developer, is an inclusive and responsible business that is helping to build a better society. Known for many major projects, we are creating, upgrading and maintaining the country’s buildings and infrastructure. Drawing on our Scandinavian heritage, we are green, innovative and progressive. We bring together people and technology, helping to make our industry safer and more collaborative. <\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p>Our infrastructure team brings its design, build and refurbishment expertise to complex projects across the country. We form strong partnerships with clients and communities to deliver major infrastructure improvements like Crossrail, HS2, A14 and the M25 widening. <\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p>As Project Manager you will lead a team to deliver a section of the project, ensuring all works are delivered on time, within budget and to the highest standards of safety, compliance, customer excellence and commercial control.<br> <\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>You Will: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Develop, manage and monitor the works ensuring all elements are, delivered (to cost and time) in accordance with legislative, regulatory, technical standards, policies and procedures. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Liaise closely with the Interface manager to ensure the highest standard of community engagement and stakeholder management SEE (Skill, Employment, Education) and legacy commitments are achieved. Support the Senior Project Manager in identifying areas for improvement, leading on initiatives as appropriate. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Maximise staff engagement through actively contributing to the general wellbeing of the team, including supply chain partners. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Continually monitor safety performance and foster a culture of collaboration, focussed on achieving an Injury Free Environment. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Establish suitably sized, skilled and competent teams to deliver the project. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Build effective relationships with senior members of the supply chain and client teams <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Adopt a proactive approach on the project to identify best practice, implement improvements, gather and feedback knowledge and inform the team on “what good looks like” <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Compliance with CDM Regulations and duties of Principal Contractor role, ensuring adherence to Client H&amp;S Plans, development of Construction Phase H&amp;S Plans and completion of regular Site Safety Inspections and Audits. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ensuring any non-conformance is managed in accordance with Skanska procedure. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Support, mentor and coach members within the team to ensure effective career development.<br> <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>We’re Looking For: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Experience leading teams delivering significant Infrastructure projects,<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Degree \u002F HND or other appropriate Civil Engineering qualification<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Good knowledge and experience of Design (temp and perm) heavy Civils, Utility works, demolition, site clearance and remediation. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Experienced in the use and management of NEC suite of contracts.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Familiar with current project controls and planning principles, excellent analytical and problem-solving skills<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Demonstrable collaborative behaviours and communication skills (essential)<br> <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p>To build on the continued success and partnership we enjoy with one of our key clients - the Defence Infrastructure Organisation (DIO), we are seeking an experienced Senior Project Manager (Construction Lead) to manage the interface between the client, project construction team, design teams and specialist sub-contractors teams from bid through to delivery stage.<\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p>This is a key role in which you will drive a collaborative approach between client (DIO) and Skanska to ensure the best outcome for all Stakeholders.<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>You Will:<\u002Fp> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Alongside the Project Director, lead elements of the tendering and bidding process to secure a successful project win. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Represent the company at meetings, promote the correct company image and ensure staff are aware of their responsibilities in this area<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Familiarise and understand the contract programme and the mode and method strategy.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Lead the management of design consultants to ensure information is provide to suit the procurement strategy, manage the production of working drawings by trade contractors within the given timeframes<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Oversee all works of the trade contractors, contributing to the selection of key specialists, suppliers, productions including the production of working drawings, procurement and prefabrication and performance on site.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ensure design solutions offered by designers and trade contractors fully comply with the project documentation within the given timeframes. Add value to the design development process by challenging solutions and methods.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>We’re Looking For:<\u002Fp> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Experience of the successful tendering and delivery of Defence related construction projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Able to obtain necessary security clearances to work on UK defence projects and government bodies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrable building sector experience as a Senior\u002FProject Manager.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrable experience leading in bids and tenders.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Key understanding of programme and the importance of sequence within construction projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrable experience managing and leading a team at delivery phase.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Educated to HNC level of equivalent essential<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Likely to hold professional qualification (MCIOB)<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b>Equal opportunities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <p>We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p><b>Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <div>\n        <p> The role of<\u002Fp>\n        <div>\n          the Utilities\n         <p> Compliance Manager<\u002Fp>\n        <\u002Fdiv> is to ensure the Health and Safety requirements are met and within every team of people who are required to excavate, or work within an excavation, or on or near underground\u002Foverhead utilities must be competent and adequately trained for the task being undertaken.\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <p><\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Main responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> <\u002Fp>\n       <div>\n        <div>\n         <div>\n          <div>\n           <div>\n            <ul>\n             <ul>\n              <li>Responsible for the assessments of staff prior to their formal appointments.<\u002Fli> \n              <li>Assist with the production of job specific RAMS\u002FWPP and agree the method of excavation works around or adjacent to services. If it is not an accepted technique as detailed as a minimum within national guidance HSG47 seek further approval\u002Fisolation from statutory undertakers.<\u002Fli> \n              <li>Ensuring project awareness when working around buried services and the culture of risk management related to underground services.<\u002Fli> \n              <li>Authorises the permit to disturb ground ensuring that the permit consists of the correct information, control measures and latest utility drawing as produced by the CAD department<\u002Fli> \n              <li>Appoints a deputy ‘Authorising Person’ in the event of their absence<\u002Fli> \n              <li>Ensures that correct training requirements have been met for anyone using cable locating equipment; this will include the formal assessment of the competency of the utility surveyor<\u002Fli>\n             <\u002Ful>\n            <\u002Ful>\n            <br> \n            <div><\u002Fdiv>\n            <br> \n            <div>\n             <p><b>Minimum Training requirements skillsets and experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n             <ul>\n              <li> Familiar with the use of cable detection equipment including RD8100 and ground penetrating radar with a minimum qualification of NVQ level 5 in utility mapping and surveying.<\u002Fli>\n              <li> Previously undertaken a similar role elsewhere and have excellent knowledge of safe working methods and procedures around services.<\u002Fli>\n              <li> Experience with working in the utilities industry and be familiar with standards, practices and procedures.<\u002Fli>\n              <li> Has excellent communication skills and be able to deliver briefings to the workforce.<\u002Fli>\n              <li> Has a good understanding of PAS128 and the coding system<\u002Fli>\n              <li> Be proficient in the use of AutoCAD or Microstation<\u002Fli>\n             <\u002Ful>\n            <\u002Fdiv>\n           <\u002Fdiv>\n          <\u002Fdiv>\n          <br> \n         <\u002Fdiv>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p><b>Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <b>Type of contract: <\u002Fb>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      Permanent \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <b>ID: <\u002Fb>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      499 \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements<br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <br> \n      <p>The role will be to handle the maintenance and repair of the complete range of mechanical and electrical engineering services associated with the Health Care estate. This will include, for example, electrical power, nurse call systems, communication systems, plant and other alarms, fire alarm systems, UPS units, electrical distribution systems, motors and control equipment, portable equipment, catering equipment and fixed plant, Control panels, sockets, lighting, electrical accessory’s, HVAC, Pumps, Motors, AHU’s and building management systems.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> You’ll:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Handle routine daily checking of the telephone switches, Deal with Modifications to the telephone infrastructure wiring, Handle relocation of existing telephones. Monitoring of the call logging equipment. Monitoring of the voicemail system. Monitoring of the auto attendant system.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Liaison with external contractors (BT\u002FVirgin) as required.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Complete all record sheets and paperwork associated with routine duties accurately and in good time.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake correctly and to a high standard the work associated with PPM (Pre Planned Maintenance) and Reactive Maintenance tasks.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake correctly and to a high standard the work associated with an inspection and testing programme both for fixed and mobile\u002Fportable equipment, ensuring compliance with the latest edition of the wiring regulations BS7671. Requesting remedial works or emergency isolations as and when required. Issue the appropriate completion certificates.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake correctly and to a high standard the work associated with an inspection and testing programme both for installed plant, fixed and mobile\u002Fportable equipment.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Follow engineering and building drawings and specifications, providing satisfactory levels of output linked with high standards or workmanship for complex systems, fully understanding the relationship between mechanical and electrical systems.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Determine what spares, components or supplies are needed in order to satisfactorily undertake and complete the work associated with repair, routine servicing and new installations.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake project work providing technical information or circuit design modification details eg boiler control system, and updating circuit records as appropriate. Routinely undertaking the complex duties involved in completing the project and taking a lead in co-ordinating the work between Trust estates staff and contractors. Undertake Cat D (work detailed as new or replacement and\u002For adaptation) work as required.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Responsible for ensuring all work carried out is to current electrical standards ie IEE Regulations and associated codes of practice. To work in accordance with the requirements of HTM 2020, The Electrical Safety Code for Low Voltage Systems as appointed Competent Person (LV) for the Trust.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake fault finding on complex Low Voltage (LV) networks, critical systems and equipment, liaise with Engineering Supervisor regarding plant or equipment failure and to request the supply of goods and services as necessary.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> To undertake work on equipment or services or both where a special and higher level of skill is required above that of craft grade (usually special training for this will be necessary).<\u002Fli>\n       <li> To undertake the responsibilities of the Shift Team Leader in their absence if required in relation to supervision of day operational staff, across all trades, in the absence of Engineering or Building Supervisor.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> We’re looking for:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Hold a full UK driving licence.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Evidence of working within acute health care premises would be advantageous (but not essential).<\u002Fli>\n       <li> The post holder will have an ability to communicate and co-ordinate tasks effectively.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> As this is a key front-line post, the post holder represents the Department directly to the Client group. Therefore, the post holder must have a high standard of customer care skills, have a pleasant manner, good communication skills, numerate and have keyboard skills.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> NVQ level 3 in electrical engineering or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n       <li> 18th Edition or the IEE Wiring Regulations.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Completed a recognised training course in Telecommunications.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Completion of a structured training programme in Electrical Engineering<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. Please contact us using <b>recruitment@skanska.co.uk<\u002Fb> if you require any adjustments that would support you throughout your application.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> More information about the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Please note this is an advert for our job vacancy, and therefore may not be inclusive of all assigned duties, responsibilities, or aspects of the role described, and may be amended at any time at the sole discretion of Skanska. For a full role profile, please contact us: <b>recruitment@skanska.co.uk<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Closing date<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> The closing date for this vacancy may be subject class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p>Our Skanska Costain STRABAG joint venture team is working in partnership with HS2 to deliver the new London tunnels from Euston to West Ruislip. Our joint venture team is working on sites at Euston, Old Oak Common and West Ruislip, building tunnels 13 miles long and up to 50m deep, supporting delivery of HS2 phase one.<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p> We are looking for a <b>SCL Supervising Engineer <\u002Fb>to join our <b>HS2<\u002Fb> team onsite in<b> London<\u002Fb>. You will be responsible for ensuring the site set up and SCL works on site, taking a significant role in delivery as well as managing aspects of time, cost and quality<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div> \n       <div>\n        <div>\n         <div>\n          <div>\n           <div>\n            <div>\n             <div>\n              <div>\n               <div>\n                <p><b>Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n                <div>\n                 <p>The role of the SCL supervising engineer focuses on the technical aspects and quality control of the SCL construction.<\u002Fp>\n                <\u002Fdiv> \n                <div>\n                 <p>The position reports to the Senior SCL Engineer and maintains a position that is independent to the delivery team.<\u002Fp>\n                <\u002Fdiv> \n                <div>\n                 <p>The construction tasks to be managed are shaft and adit construction. The role will be located at one of four specific shaft work sites, which could change as work progresses.<\u002Fp>\n                <\u002Fdiv> \n                <div>\n                 <p>The SCL Supervisor will be responsible for the engineering management of the SCL activities in the shafts and their related adits generally during the night shifts when the Senior SCL Engineer is not present. The SCL Supervisor is to act as an independent witness to the SCL construction activities and will have the authority to halt works where failure to follow agreed methodology or meet quality requirements is observed.<\u002Fp>\n                <\u002Fdiv> \n                <div>\n                 <p>The SCL Supervisor will oversee, witness and record the Engineering and Quality aspects of the SCL activities as identified in the Inspection and Test Plan and ensure that the requirements of the RESS are followed by the delivery team.<\u002Fp>\n                <\u002Fdiv> \n                <div>\n                 <p>The SCL Supervisor will hold a daily Shift Review Group meeting. They will prepare handover notes at the end of the shift and read and act upon the handover notes prepared by the previous shift. Any incidents, issues or points of note are to be clearly forwarded on to the following day shift,<\u002Fp>\n                <\u002Fdiv> \n                <div>\n                 <p>The role will act as the assurance of the process during SCL production, ensuring the demands of the design is undertaken by the construction delivery team. The role will cover 5no shafts in the Central Area.<\u002Fp>\n                <\u002Fdiv> \n                <div>\n                 <p>The opportunity exists to mentor and develop the technical members of the shafts SCL engineering team.<\u002Fp>\n                <\u002Fdiv>\n                <br> \n               <\u002Fdiv>\n              <\u002Fdiv>\n              <br> \n              <p><\u002Fp>\n              <div>\n               <div>\n                <p><b>Key responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n                <div>\n                 <p>This role will cover at least one of the following areas:<\u002Fp>\n                <\u002Fdiv>\n                <br> \n                <p><\u002Fp>\n                <p>Engineering Risk Management<\u002Fp> \n                <ul>\n                 <li> Managing the monitoring of ground movements against predicted values<\u002Fli>\n                <\u002Ful> \n                <ul>\n                 <li>Managing the response to unexpected ground conditions<\u002Fli>\n                <\u002Ful> \n                <ul>\n                 <li>Ensuring that the construction team meets their responsibilities under CDM,<\u002Fli>\n                <\u002Ful>\n                <br> \n                <p><\u002Fp>\n                <p>Quality &amp; Assurance<\u002Fp> \n                <ul>\n                 <li>Oversight of materials testing; ensuring the correct tests are being undertaken in a timely manner for a particular section of the project, ensuring the results of testing are communicated<\u002Fli>\n                <\u002Ful> \n                <ul>\n                 <li>Oversight of the production, review, approval and implementation of ITPs, which are produced by the construction team in accordance with the processes managed by the Quality team<\u002Fli>\n                <\u002Ful> \n                <ul>\n                 <li>Oversight of the construction assurance process, which is undertaken by the construction team in accordance with the processes managed by the Assurance team<\u002Fli>\n                <\u002Ful>\n                <br> \n                <p><\u002Fp>\n                <p>Design Integration and Change Control<\u002Fp> \n                <ul>\n                 <li>Reviewing permanent works design and ensuring appropriate input from the construction team<\u002Fli>\n                <\u002Ful> \n                <ul>\n                 <li>Identifying any changes during construction that could have an impact on either the temporary works design or permanent works design and control of that change<\u002Fli>\n                <\u002Ful> \n                <ul>\n                 <li>Oversight of temporary works planning, coordination, design, installation, use and removal including review and approval of significant temporary works: their design and method statements<\u002Fli>\n                <\u002Ful>\n                <br> \n                <p><\u002Fp>\n class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p><b>Commercial Manager – South West <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p>BoKlok is a housing concept developed by Skanska and IKEA. Together we build sustainable homes for the many people. Thanks to our combined experience, we do it with good design, function, and quality. We have employees in Sweden, Norway, Finland, and the United Kingdom and are responsible for the entire value chain from land acquisition and product development right up to occupancy by our customers in those regions. <\u002Fp>\n      <p>Do you want to be part of our continued journey of success and contribute to a better society by making sustainable living a reality for the many people? The right candidate will have effectively managed costs for the project, ensure targets are met by managing and controlling budget and valuations including monthly updating of final costs. <\u002Fp>\n      <p><b>Key responsibilities will include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Have ownership of Project Book from RFI Land through to end of making good defects <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Input into ‘Key rates’ across the business for Reviews <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Provide input and cost and value engineering advice throughout the design life of the scheme and attend design team meetings.<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Strive to optimise the profitability of the Scheme <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ensure that the Contracts achieve the optimum cashflow position. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Completion and compliance with required contract documentation including Performance Bonds, Parent Company Guarantees and Warranties. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ensure that all contract documentation and sub-contract documentation is completed and forwarded to the Commercial Manager\u002FDirector for authorisation and storage. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Compliance with Commercial and Company procedures through the ‘The Boklok Way’ System. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Prepare and manage key and large risk subcontract accounts from inception to final accounts.<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Subcontract procurement strategy and implementation. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Minor material &amp; prelims procurement <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ensure the procurement of sub-contractors is in line with the ‘The Boklok Way’ and that the packages cover the scope of the works. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Check and ensure compliance and issuing of timely Payment and Pay less notices to Subcontractors. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Control, monitor and improve commercial processes and deliver the objectives and targets for the project teams. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Preparing monthly CVR\u002FCVC reports for presentation to the Business Unit Management. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Monitoring risk and opportunity schedules and managing risk from Commencement to Completion. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ensure a proactive approach to dispute avoidance. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ensure company health and safety standards and procedures are followed throughout the team<br> <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>We're Looking For:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Experience in both residential development and modular construction is highly preferred. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Proven experience of supply chain management. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Manage the discharge of section 104\u002F106\u002F278\u002F38 and any relevant statutory or 3rd party obligations. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Proven experience with meeting customer expectations and ability to demonstrate customer centric approach during build and aftercare,‘Customer journey’. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Understanding of sales process and market conditions. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Innovative - ability to identify better ways of doing things. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Learning from mistakes and successes.<br> <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>Competencies <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Deliver Results <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Understanding Customer experience<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Mantain a safe environment<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Communicate<br> <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich Bristol<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> Our graduate programme will help you build on your degree and establish a career where you will have the freedom to learn, achieve your ambitions and leave your mark on the communities in which we work.<\u002Fp>\n      <div>\n       <br> As a Graduate Business Support Manager, you will become a key member of our Building Services Facilities Management Team. As a team we are responsible for the delivery of a Total Facilities Management Service to a portfolio of mainstream, academy and school sites, including secondary, primary, nursery and SEN schools in Bristol (Bristol Schools).\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n        You will be responsible for the day-to-day coordination and management of supply chain partners for both a range of soft (cleaning, catering, reception etc) and hard facilities management packages such as lighting, heating, air-conditioning etc. This will involve building and maintaining successful relationships with our supply chain partners to help us meet or exceed our contract delivery requirements. In addition, you will be required to support a broad range of contractual exercises and periodic deliverables. In doing so, you will gain extensive knowledge in a wide range of services that we deliver and obligations that we are required meet.\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <b> You will:<\u002Fb>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <ul>\n        <li><br> Learn and embed yourself within the Bristol Schools facilities management team – develop an in-depth understanding of all aspects of the business<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Assist with collating data and records for supply chain performance meetings, contract tender and renewal process, along with contractual exercises such as Benchmarking<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Build and maintain successful relationships with our supply chain partners, whilst driving collaboration<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Monitor performance against agreed KPIs (key performance indicators) and SLA’s (service level agreements)<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Support internal, external, client and supply chain auditing and close out of actions<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Support the senior management team in delivering against the Skanska 2024 Business Plan objectives.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Act as Gatekeeper for the project Master Filing System and liaise with respective areas of the team to maintain and up to date and compliant document control system<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Ensure records\u002Fcertificates are always kept up to date in line with the contractual requirements<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Escalate non-compliance to the General Manager. Liaise with our helpdesk team and play a key role in resolving issues effectively<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Assist with the coordination and management of training and appointments to ensure the team is compliant with regards to legislation<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Assist with the production and compilation of monthly, annual and periodic reports required by either the client or the project management team<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Support the senior management team in attending strategic and other key client or internal meetings, collating actions and minutes for distribution as applicable<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Complete any other tasks reasonably requested by Bristol Schools senior management team or the client<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <b><br> Who you are:<\u002Fb>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <ul>\n        <li><br> Studying towards (final year) or having completed bachelor’s or master’s degree in a Business or Project Management subject<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Effective communicator and collaborative in approach – the role will involve working with numerous people from different disciplines<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Problem solver<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Comfortable with standard Microsoft Office applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.), work towards membership of your chosen professional body<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Project management and leadership development mentoring<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Opportunities to volunteer at least one <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p>Our UK-wide building team has built a reputation for high quality offices in Commercial and Mixed-used developments, Healthcare, Custodial, Defence, and Education. Our award-winning projects include 52 Lime Street, 30 St Mary Axe, Bristol Schools, St Bartholomew and the Royal London Hospitals to name a few.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> We are now seeking a Carbon Manager to assist in delivery of customer expectations on carbon measurement and reduction in CO2 emissions to drive our leadership position in carbon reduction. This is a key role where you will support and assist in the delivery of the Skanska Building and Skanska UK carbon reduction strategy, objectives and targets.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> You will: <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Provide prioritised carbon reduction technical support to bids and other work winning initiatives, as appropriate to resources, time and importance;<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Collaborate on and coordinate the development, update and delivery of the Building carbon data improvement plan, including achieving consistency of carbon data and measurement across all projects;<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Support Building in the development, maintenance and updating of carbon forecasting and reporting, against targets, including carbon dashboards.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Promote innovation in carbon reduction, through process and solutions;<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Support carbon upskilling for key roles within Building to help translate technical expertise into tangible actions;<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Responsible for supporting the delivery of projects’ carbon requirements;<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p> We’re looking for: <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Experience \u002F competence in embodied carbon assessment methods, reporting standards and guidance, and their applicability across the Building sector, including the RICS Whole Life Carbon approach <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Experience \u002F competence in delivering carbon reduction solutions for customers during the design and construction phases <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Analytical, data and process driven mindset <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Experience \u002F competence generating and delivering improvement initiatives within an built a reputation for high quality in offices, mixed-use developments, education and healthcare. Our projects include iconic projects like the Scalpel, Heron Tower and The Gherkin.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Currently we are looking for a Senior Project Surveyor to join the team to work on one of our new projects based in the Gloucester region.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> You will work with the project team to provide package procurement, cost control and ensure that the financial position of a construction project is reported accurately and controlled effectively and is maintained throughout; whilst guiding and developing all project staff on commercial issues.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> You'll<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul> \n       <li>Control the cost management for project, specifically groundworks and remediation, providing financial reporting regularly<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Understand allowances for elements of work (Preliminaries, materials, subcontract etc.)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Understand the contractual requirements of project documents including the roles and responsibilities of all involved and the notices required to record change etc. Ensure all required notices are issued in a timely manner.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Understand the forecast cost to completion, establish and use cost management systems<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in risk and opportunity management (with operations team) of known and newly identified risks and opportunities for best project return<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepare subcontract documentation, issue enquiries, and negotiate agreements including interim and final accounts<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>We're Looking For<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul> \n       <li>Experience working on medium to large groundworks, civils and\u002For Infrastructure packages. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>BSc or HND in Quantity Surveying or other equivalent construction related subject, preferably qualified to ICES or RICS accreditation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Have excellent knowledge of NEC forms of construction contracts, particularly NEC3 option A.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Self-motivated and confident, financially astute with good communication skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>A good decision maker who copes well under pressure<\u002Fli> \n       <li>SMSTS qualified with the relevant CSCS Card<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be <\u002Fb>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      2376 \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p><b>Job Introduction <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p>The role of Quantity Surveyor is responsible for providing accurate and value generating input to projects. The role ensures that all commercial aspects are carried out in accordance with the contract, company policies and procedures, and to the satisfaction of the customer and\u002For contract leader. This role may work independently or under the direction of a more senior Quantity Surveyor. The QS will be able to demonstrate the ability to function as a member of an integrated team.<br> <\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>Main Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Inputting to the efficient and effective management and issuing of accurate, timely and compliant notices and correspondence <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Preparation or assessment of applications, valuations, cost\u002Fvalue reconciliation. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Cost control and forecasting. Prepare and provide input to monthly reports: value, cost, profit\u002Floss, cash flow and budget. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Preparation and agreement of applications for payment or the assessment &amp; preparation of payment certificates. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Assisting with Risk and Value Management to optimise solution. Monitor and regularly review with the project team. Identifying, analysing and developing responses to commercial risks. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Contract Management, including all relevant contractual forms, methods of budgetary control and relevant software applications. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Prepare supply chain enquiries, negotiate, administer and finalise \u002F close out supply chain contracts. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ensure all notifications\u002Fdocuments are managed in accordance with the contract, and customer \u002F company policy. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Ongoing liaison with site team, subcontractors and Customers’ representatives <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Undertake record-keeping including but not limited to collating site records, the preparation of meeting packs, meeting invites and taking meeting minutes <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p>As Graduate Manager you will become a key member of our Facilities Management team, responsible for the provision of Hard and Soft FM services at Northwood Headquarters. In this role you will have the opportunity to learn about Facilities management and general business activities, and to assist your development you will be expected to lead a range of improvement programmes.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Part of your development will be to form great stakeholder relationships with those that are involved in the Project, for example Skanska and our employees, the Authority or the PFI (Private Finance Initiative) management company – Eastbury Park Limited.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> The role will develop from one of learning into you holding responsibility to successfully implement change programmes<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> About Northwood:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Northwood HQ is made up of the UK military headquarters, NATO maritime headquarters and an EU operations headquarters. Approximately 2,500 military personnel work on the site and over 850 people live on the base<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Skanska UK provides a complete facilities management solution for the Ministry of Defence Northwood HQ site in Hertfordshire.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> We are experts at working in highly controlled, secure environments. We provide all non-military support on the site. This includes all facilities management services, such as buildings maintenance, grounds maintenance and IT communications infrastructure support.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Overview of responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Be inducted into all Hard (i.e. Mechanical and electrical planned and reactive maintenance, or asset management) and Soft (i.e. cleaning and catering staff, grounds maintenance, or receptionists) Facilities Management and enabling functions that are site based, develop business and technical knowledge, and understanding how each function contributes to the delivery of the contract.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Understand the principles of the contract agreement and how this requires us to work, and through the graduate programme considering compliance to these principles in all activity that you are involved with.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Assist with the collation and analysis of quality and performance data and records, and support to onward communicate results.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Work with operations teams to embed a Continuous Improvement programme and develop this programme by expanding agreed modules into other operational teams.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Using formed relationships, work with function teams to develop new ways of working that provide improvement – in service, quality for cost. Importantly to generate new ways of working ideas through the engagement of our employees.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Prepare and present programme reports and findings and prepare business proposals to the Leadership Team to progress improvement ideas into operational delivery.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> As your role develops it is expected that there is opportunity to identify your personal development plan and be trained on relevant programmes that will assist your early career route.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b><br> Who you are:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Recent graduate or currently studying towards business\u002Ffacilities management qualification<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Genuinely interested in facilities management and building services industry<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Enthusiastic to learn<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> British citizenship is required for this role due to the nature of the project<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b><br> What we offer:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Complete study support with a clear career pathway and programme<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Line manager, buddy and wider Skanska support to help you succeed<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> A competitive apprentice salary and other benefits including London travel allowance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b><br> About Skanska<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Skanska is one the UK’s top construction and development companies. We are building, upgrading and maintaining the country’s infrastructure for future generations. Drawing on our Scandinavian heritage, we are green, innovative and progressive. We bring together people and technology, as part of our objective to make construction a safer and more collaborative industry.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> We believe in our Purpose; we build for a better society. Through our Values of care for life, commit to customers, be better – together and act ethically and transparently you will enable us to deliver our purpose.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> At Skanska, we thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender, age, religion, sexuality and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and winning teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <b><br> Programme start date:<\u002Fb> 2023\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <b> Location:<\u002Fb> Ministry of Defence Northwood HQ site in Hertfordshire.\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><br> At Skanska, we believe in our Purpose, we build for a better society. Through our Values of care for life, commit to customers, be better – together and act ethically and transparently you will enable us to deliver our purpose.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <div>\n       <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process.   <b>ID: <\u002Fb>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      2372 \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p><b>Project Manager – Bristol Region<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n       <p>BoKlok is a housing concept developed by Skanska and IKEA. Together we build sustainable, quality homes at a low price for everyone. Thanks to our combined experience, we can do it with good design, function and quality. We have employees in Sweden, Norway, Finland and the United Kingdom and are responsible for the entire value chain from land acquisition and product development right up to occupancy in those regions. <\u002Fp>\n       <p>As Project Manager, you will lead the day to day design and construction management of residential projects in a safe and compliant manner. Project values vary from £10Million to £75Million up. <\u002Fp>\n       <p>This is a key role where you will hold responsibility for delivering within budget and programme to the satisfaction of key stakeholders.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b> Your Responsibilities Will Include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li>Draft, agree and monitor the contract programme and the mode and method of construction.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Plan and communicate each stage of the project’s lifecycle, through Design, Sign Off, Manufacture, Procurement &amp; Onsite delivery.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Manage the interface between the development and build functions with the Design Manager and work with their on-site build team and trade contractors in the production of working drawings, procurement and prefabrication and performance on site.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Ensure good communications within the project and regularly brief other team members.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Provide regular written progress reports to monitor performance and highlight deficiencies at an early stage.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Demonstrate how to achieve a quality focussed development.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Ensuring compliance to BOPAS, NHBC and Building Control criteria.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Ensure all design solutions offered by designers and sub-contractors fully comply with the project documentation and budget strategy.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Assist in the management of design consultants to ensure information is provided to suit the procurement strategy and that the production of working drawings is completed within given timeframes, working with the DM in delivering a cohesive design that reflects the project and the budget.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Experience of Statutory design Compliance arrangements, S106\u002F278, Building Control, Building Regs Environmental considerations etc.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Add value to the design process by challenging solutions, methods and techniques where appropriate to improve build ability, develop repeatability and reduce whole life costs<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Implement correct commercial control of build contract and the contractors, within pre-set budgets. Ensure that contractual and claim correspondence is suitably actioned within agreed timeframes<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Assist in the implementation of a Risk Management Process for the project.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Assist in the Procurement of Suppliers and Designers and 3rd parties.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Ongoing management and tracking of expenditure, with the commercial Manager.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Promote and maintain BoKlok’s safety culture. Ensure that all works are carried out in a planned, controlled and safe manner in accordance with statutory regulations, current standards and company health, safety environmental and quality standards<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Lead and organise the compliance procedure, including benchmarking and implantation of a full Inspection &amp; Test Plan process.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Coordinate with the design team and supply chain to ensure compliance with the fire strategy and facilitate sufficient records to allow sign off by the fire officer and production of an EWS1 form.<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p><b> We’re Looking For:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li>Experience in both residential development and modular construction is highly preferred.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Proven experience of supply chain management.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Experienced in managing the discharge of section 106\u002F278 and any relevant statutory or 3rd party obligations.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Demonstrable experience of delivering residential projects on a progressive value scale from 10-75m within budget and programme.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Proven experience with meeting customer expectations and ability to demonstrate customer centric approach during build and aftercare.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Innovative - ability to identify better ways of doing things<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Driven – constantly focused on improving performance, doing everything to the best of your ability and making the best of every situation.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Flexible – willing to adapt to change and proactive in looking for better ways of delivering our homes.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Ability to learn from mistakes and successes.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Competent in MS Office, Project Programmes and BIM.<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p> A career with us means you’ll have the freedom to develop your skills and leave your mark on the communities in which we work and the customers for whom we build. Our competitive benefits package will help to enhance your life outside work, too.<\u002Fp>\n       <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender, age, religion, sexuality and any other protected characteristic, we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and winning teams. Make your next career move with us.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. Please contact us using <b>recruitment@skanska.co.uk<\u002Fb> if you require any adjustments that would support you throughout your application.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> More information about the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> Please note this is an advert for our job vacancy, and therefore may not be inclusive of all assigned duties, responsibilities, or aspects of the role described, and may be amended at any time at the sole discretion of Skanska. For a full role profile, please contact us: <b>recruitment@skanska.co.uk<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Closing date<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> The closing date for this vacancy may be subject to change any time at the sole discretion of the business.<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p><b>Our UK-wide building team has built a reputation for high quality offices in Commercial and Mixed-used developments, Healthcare, Custodial, Defence, and Education. Our award-winning projects include 52 Lime Street, 30 St Mary Axe, Bristol Schools, St Bartholomew and the Royal London Hospitals to name a few.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> To build on our success we are looking to recruit a BIM Manager to manage the implementation and delivery of Building Information Modelling within our London Building Division.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> The role will be responsible for delivering both project requirements and the business digital strategy. Champion the cultural and process changes that are essential to adoption of BIM technologies and new ways of working.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Your Responsibilities will include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <b><br> <\u002Fb>\n       <li><b>The creation of project BIM Execution Plan’s (BEP) at both pre-contract and post-contract stages.<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <b> <\u002Fb>\n       <li><b>Management of the BIM Management Workbok (BMWB) in collaboration with Design Management, Commercial and Planning functions.<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <b> <\u002Fb>\n       <li><b>Supporting the clash detection process by federating models and managing the checking process. Work with the Design Management team to review errors and report responsibility where necessary<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <b> <\u002Fb>\n       <li><b>Managing the consultants and supply chain BIM delivery. Host training sessions where required and validate their deliverables to ensure compliance with project Employers Information Requirements (EIR)<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <b> <\u002Fb>\n       <li><b>Supporting Design Team Meetings (DTM) with regards to BIM. Prepare the models for review and navigate the software during the sessions.<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <b> <\u002Fb>\n       <li><b>Attending the OU digital forum’s and contribute to the sessions by demonstrating London digital initiatives<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <b> <\u002Fb>\n       <li><b>Formulating technical guidance documents to support training in both written and recorded digital content.<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <b><br> <\u002Fb>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><b>We’re looking for:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul> \n       <li><b>Proficiency in the use of software such as Revit, AutoCAD, Navisworks Manager and Solibri model checker, BIM 360 Field, BIM 360 Glue<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Familiar with data exchange formats such as DGN, DWG, NWD, IFC and COBie<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Have a good working knowledge of industry standards such as PAS 1192-2: 2013 and BS 1192: 2007<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Have an understanding of the construction industry in the context of BIM<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <li><b> Previous practical experience of 3D modeling, embedded data, collaboration and coordination software.<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <li><b> Minimum of 4 year recent experience in a building\u002F MEP construction role<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <li><b> Have an understanding of the construction industry in the context of BIM<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. the business<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Be capable of understanding and managing the contractual requirements of multiple live projects ensuring the contract is administered correctly<\u002Fli>\n    <p>The Area Tunnel Engineering Team sits independently from the Area Tunnel Delivery Team and provides technical support and management to the tunnelling operation, both for the Sprayed Concrete Lining (SCL) and Tunnel Boring Machine (TBM) tunnel drives across the project.<\u002Fp>\n        <p><\u002Fp>\n        <p><br> The Area Tunnel Engineering Team is led by the Tunnel Engineering Manager who has specific responsibility for a specific tunnel drive, or series of tunnel drives. The Senior Tunnel Engineer sits within the Tunnel Engineering Team, reporting directly to the Tunnel Engineering Manager.<\u002Fp>\n        <p><\u002Fp>\n        <p><b><br> Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n        <p><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n        <p>The role of the Senior Tunnel Engineer is to manage the Shift Review Group process, including running the SRG, MAT meetings, contributing to the CTC meetings as directed by the Tunnel Engineering Manager.<\u002Fp>\n        <p><\u002Fp>\n        <p><br> The role of Senior Tunnel Engineer is a technical management position. Technical interfaces with various internal and external stakeholders will be a key part of the role and the Senior Tunnel Engineer will be representing the SCS JV as part of this role.<\u002Fp>\n        <p><\u002Fp>\n        <p><b><br> Specific Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n        <p><\u002Fp>\n        <ul> \n         <li>For the TBM tunnels, producing the DTAP sheets in accordance with the tunnel drive drawings; reporting on compliance<\u002Fli>\n        <\u002Ful>\n        <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n        <ul>\n         <li>Coordinating the inputs to the SRG<\u002Fli>\n        <\u002Ful>\n        <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n        <ul>\n         <li>Coordination with the Area Based I&amp;M Engineering Manager to ensure works are covered<\u002Fli>\n        <\u002Ful>\n        <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n        <ul>\n         <li>Managing the interface with MissionOS and TBM management software to ensure that monitoring data and TBM data is captured and available<\u002Fli>\n        <\u002Ful>\n        <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n        <ul>\n         <li>Providing the information to the Tunnelling Engineering Manager for the production of the ‘drive’ report and collating the inputs to the Daily Shift Review Groups (SRG)<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Engineering review of RAMS \u002F ITPs as directed by the Tunnelling Engineering Manager<\u002Fli>\n        <\u002Ful>\n        <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n        <p>Being a member of the Engineering Management team provides opportunity to contribute into other aspects of this discipline; such as Asset Protection, Instrumentation and Monitoring, etc and provide direction, advice and support to the associated design and construction teams as appropriate.<\u002Fp>\n        <p><\u002Fp>\n        <p><b><br> Required qualifications, skills, behaviours and     <b>Graduate Design Co-ordinator<\u002Fb>\n        <b> – Development Programme 2023 (London, Bristol or Gloucester)<\u002Fb>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <br>
