UK. You will help build its success and reputation for delivering high quality projects in commercial and mixed-used developments across healthcare, custodial, education and defence sectors.\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <br> Our award-winning public-sector projects include Bath Spa University, 52 Lime Street, Bristol Schools, and the Royal London Hospital to name a few. Our expertise in London has created a portfolio that includes some of the capital’s iconic buildings, such as The Gherkin and Heron Tower.\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <br> Our two-year graduate programme will help you build on your degree and establish a career where you’ll have the freedom to learn, achieve your ambitions, and leave your mark on the communities in which we work.\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <br> The programme provides a pathway to develop a complete skill set developing both technical and interpersonal skills. This includes courses, on-the-job learning, working in teams to solve business challenges, and building a strong professional network, all while improving the business.\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <b><br> Location: <\u002Fb>You will join our London or Southwest (Gloucester\u002F Bristol) teams. Please specify your preferred location.\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <b><br> What you will do:<\u002Fb>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <ul>\n         <li> Be a core part of the Design Management team to drive business change in the use of new and emerging digital design technologies across the business<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Support the design management process on a project, from enquiry through to submission of the tender and the ongoing management of all design related issues until project completion.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Support the delivery of design work areas, in accordance with company procedures, statutory compliance (ie planning, building control, fire, environment), programme requirements, contract requirements, and project specifications<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Undertake design reviews of using a variety of digital technologies – including building information modelling (BIM) and common data environments (CDE)<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Be responsible for the development and maintenance of the design management plan and design brief, including client requirements, cost, programme, design standards, health &amp; safety, digital design strategy, production logistics, facilities management, contract agreement<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Attend site to understand the delivery of the design process from BIM model to contract drawings through procurement and delivery on site.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Attend regular design coordination and progress reviews with design team, sub-contractors, and support the design manager with action notes and closing issues out.<\u002Fli>\n        <\u002Ful>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <b><br> Who you are:<\u002Fb>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <ul>\n         <li> Studying to degree level or having completed a degree in a construction related subject that is accredited by the RIBA, ICE or CIOB.<\u002Fli>\n         <li> A keen interest in the use of current and emerging digital design technologies to drive business change and improvement<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Values driven and passionate about sustainability<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Have excellent communications skills and attention to detail<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Commercially minded<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Enthusiastic about learning and developing new ways of thinking<\u002Fli>\n        <\u002Ful>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <b><br> What we offer:<\u002Fb>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <ul>\n         <li> Clear learning and development opportunities to build your knowledge, skills, and behaviours to prepare you for your career at Skanska<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Professional networks and mentoring to ensure success<\u002Fli>\n         <li> The opportunity to work towards membership of your chosen professional body<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Project management and leadership development mentoring<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Opportunities to volunteer at least one day per year<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Competitive benefits package<\u002Fli>\n         <li> Inclusive environment where everyone is encouraged and supported to be ‘their whole self’<\u002Fli>\n        <\u002Ful>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <br> class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p>An Environmental Advisor, forming part of the wider Environment and Sustainability team, to support the delivery of the construction and handover over phase of the HS2 Main Works Civils Contract.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Main Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li>Understand the Client and Joint Venture Partners' Environment and Sustainability Policies, Processes and statutory requirements as they affect the contract's operations and ensure that the requirements are implemented on the project.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Provide Environmental compliance advice to various team, including construction, procurement and subcontractors and suppliers on the practical implementation of contract policies, processes and requirements. Identify and provide training and upskilling required to fulfill environmental responsibilities of various delivery team roles.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Identify and communicate environmental and sustainability risks and mitigations, assisting with the review and undertaking of risk assessments and method statements. Providing critical on-site presence and advice to the delivery team.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Drive awareness for and delivery against contract targets, particularly reducing Carbon and striving to achieve no-net loss in biodiversity and BREEAM ‘Excellent’ rating. Drive innovation and continuous improvement throughout the contract team.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Provide advice and guidance, and where necessary assist with the obtaining legal consents, licenses and exemptions. Maintain good working relationships with external stakeholders such as local authorities, Natural England, EA, Thames Water and others as required and directed.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Ensure works are in line with the Environmental Management System, certified to ISO 14001:2015, ensuring it remains appropriate to all contract risks. Monitor and collect date to aid reporting against performance against targets. Undertake a program of inspections and audits, including targeted risk monitoring, both on site and within the supply chain. Assist with any external audits, parent company, client and certification bodies were required.<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n       <p><b>Ideal Candidate<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li>Environmental advisory experience in the environment and construction industry, ideally projects in rail, highways or tunnelling.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Degree or equivalent in Environmental Sciences or suitably applicable fields. Associate or Practitioner Member of the Institute of Environmental Management and Assessment (IEMA) or equivalent and internal auditing experience ideally.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Good organisation and time management skills, able to work independently and off their own initiative. Confident speaker with experience preparing and delivering presentations.<\u002Fli> \n        <li>Demonstrates a passion for the Environment and Sustainability, driving innovation and a desire to positively influence and develop those around them<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <br> \n       <br> \n       <br> \n       <br> \n       <p><b>Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. to Caxton Gibbet is a £750 million improvement scheme, the scheme involves the creation of a new three tier junction at the existing Black Cat roundabout, over 10 miles of new dual carriageway along with 17 structures to be created, one of which is a viaduct over the Great River Ouse. There is interface with services ranging from high pressure gas pipeline to 400 KV overhead lines. <\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p>This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced safety professional to work in a collaborative environment influencing and leading on all aspects of health and safety performance.<\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p><b> Main Duties &amp; Responsibilities<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Ensure that Company and project requirements \u002F KPI’S are being maintained and standards met across the scheme<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Provide operational and functional management with advice on the prevention of accidents, ill health, and the practical implementation of the company’s SHW policies.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Participation and undertaking of HSW visits with the Project SLT as well as both Client and Skanska lead tours<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensuring and supporting the project management team in compliance \u002F execution of client required HSW standards.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Assist in the investigation of accidents, incidents, dangerous occurrences, near misses and other incidents where appropriate. Monitor and coordinate the close out of the above.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Assist in the preparation and implementation of SHW training courses and ensure that staff with specific SHW responsibilities have received the appropriate training.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced dynamic environment.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <div>\n       <p><b> Skills, Experience &amp; Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Experience in HSW Management role within construction.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> CMIOSH Membership or working towards this.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> NEBOSH diploma or NVQ level 5 or above in Occupational Health &amp; Safety if not obtained working towards<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Level 5 academically recognised qualification or above (i.e. diploma \u002Fdegree\u002FNVQ) relating to health, safety and wellbeing.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Experience in the development and implementation of health, safety and wellbeing strategies<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Previous Highways construction environment experience<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <div>\n       <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>General information <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n     Project Management \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <b>External closing date: <\u002Fb>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      Tuesday, February 28, 2023 \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <b>Type of contract: <\u002Fb>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      Permanent \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <b>ID: <\u002Fb>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      2345 \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p><b>Project Manager – Bristol Region \u002F South Coast Region<br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <br> \n       <p>BoKlok is a housing concept developed by Skanska and IKEA. Together we build sustainable, quality homes at a low price for everyone. Thanks to our combined experience, we can do it with good design, function and quality. We have employees in Sweden, Norway, Finland and the United Kingdom and are responsible for the entire value chain from land acquisition and product development right up to occupancy in those regions. <\u002Fp>\n       <p>As Project Manager, you will lead the day to day design and construction management of residential projects in a safe and compliant manner. Project values vary from £10Million to £75Million up. <\u002Fp>\n       <p><b>This is a key role where you will hold responsibility for delivering within budget and programme to the satisfaction of key stakeholders.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p><b> Your Responsibilities Will Include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li>Draft, agree and monitor the contract programme and the mode and method of construction.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Plan and communicate each stage of the project’s lifecycle, through Design, Sign Off, Manufacture, Procurement &amp; Onsite delivery.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Manage the interface between the development and build functions with the Design Manager and work with their on-site build team and trade contractors in the production of working drawings, procurement and prefabrication and performance on site.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Ensure good communications within the project and regularly brief other team members.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Provide regular written progress reports to monitor performance and highlight deficiencies at an early stage.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Demonstrate how to achieve a quality focussed development.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Ensuring compliance to BOPAS, NHBC and Building Control criteria.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Ensure all design solutions offered by designers and sub-contractors fully comply with the project documentation and budget strategy.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Assist in the management of design consultants to ensure information is provided to suit the procurement strategy and that the production of working drawings is completed within given timeframes, working with the DM in delivering a cohesive design that reflects the project and the budget.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Experience of Statutory design Compliance arrangements, S106\u002F278, Building Control, Building Regs Environmental considerations etc.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Add value to the design process by challenging solutions, methods and techniques where appropriate to improve build ability, develop repeatability and reduce whole life costs<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Implement correct commercial control of build contract and the contractors, within pre-set budgets. Ensure that contractual and claim correspondence is suitably actioned within agreed timeframes<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Assist in the implementation of a Risk Management Process for the project.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Assist in the Procurement of Suppliers and Designers and 3rd parties.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Ongoing management and tracking of expenditure, with the commercial Manager.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Promote and maintain BoKlok’s safety culture. Ensure that all works are carried out in a planned, controlled and safe manner in accordance with statutory regulations, current standards and company health, safety environmental and quality standards<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Lead and organise the compliance procedure, including benchmarking and implantation of a full Inspection &amp; Test Plan process.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Coordinate with the design team and supply chain to ensure compliance with the fire strategy and facilitate sufficient records to allow sign off by the fire officer and production of an EWS1 form.<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p><b> We’re Looking For:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li>Experience in both residential development and modular construction is highly preferred.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Proven experience of supply chain management.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Experienced in managing the discharge of section 106\u002F278 and any relevant statutory or 3rd party obligations.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Demonstrable experience of delivering residential projects on a progressive value scale from 10-75m within budget and programme.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Proven experience with meeting customer expectations and ability to demonstrate customer centric approach during build and aftercare.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Innovative - ability to identify better ways of doing things<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Driven – constantly focused on improving performance, doing everything to the best of your ability and making the best of every situation.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Flexible – willing to adapt to change and proactive in looking for better ways of delivering our homes.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Ability to learn from mistakes and successes.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Competent in MS Office, Project Programmes and BIM.<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p><br> A career with us means you’ll have the freedom to develop your skills and leave your mark on the communities in which we work and the customers for whom we build. Our competitive benefits package will help to enhance your life outside work, too.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><br> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender, age, religion, sexuality and any other protected characteristic, we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and winning teams. Make your next career move with us.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. Please contact us using <b>recruitment@skanska.co.uk<\u002Fb> if you require any adjustments that would support you throughout your application.<\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> More information about the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> Please note this is an advert for our job vacancy, and therefore may not be inclusive of all assigned duties, responsibilities, or aspects of the role described, and may be amended at any time at the sole discretion of Skanska. For a full role profile, please contact us: <b>recruitment@skanska.co.uk<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p><b><br> Closing date<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p> The closing date for this vacancy may be    <b>Graduate Construction Management – Development Programme 2023 (Gloucester)<\u002Fb>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div><\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <br> We are looking for a Construction Management graduate to join our 2023 development programme and help us shape the future within our Building Team in Gloucester.\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div><\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <b><br> The Opportunity:<\u002Fb>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div><\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <br> You will work on the VSSP (Vehicle Storage and Support Programme) Project, which is based in Tewksbury in Gloucestershire. This is a Ministry of Defence (MoD) contract where Skanska are providing a modern, sustainable, and future-proof storage solution for over 4100 tracked &amp; wheeled British Army vehicles ready for deployment.\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div><\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <br> Our two-year graduate programme will help you build on your degree and establish a career where you’ll have the freedom to learn, achieve your ambitions, and leave your mark on the communities in which we work.\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div><\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <br> The programme provides a pathway to develop a complete skill set developing both technical and interpersonal skills. This includes courses, on-the-job learning, working in teams to solve business challenges, and building a strong professional network, all while improving the business.\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div><\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <b><br> Location: <\u002Fb>You will be based in Tewksbury, Gloucester\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div><\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <b><br> What you will do:<\u002Fb>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <ul>\n          <li> Monitor and support the supervision of trade-contractors as well as the labour and material requirements for the contract<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Ensure our operatives are working to the latest programme of works, are signed up to the relevant method statements and check they understand what is required<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Be involved in quality and compliance<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Log and resolve any defects found and challenge current methodology by putting forward innovative ideas<\u002Fli>\n         <\u002Ful>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div><\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <b><br> Who you are:<\u002Fb>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <ul>\n          <li> Studying towards degree level, or having completed a degree, in a construction related subject that is accredited by the CIOB<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Have excellent communications skills and attention to detail<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Values driven and passionate about sustainability<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Commercially minded<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Enthusiastic about learning and developing new ways of thinking<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Ability to pass high security clearance. In order to pass, both UK and non-UK subjects must have lived in the UK in the last 5 years<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Driving licence preferable due to the remote location of the project<\u002Fli>\n         <\u002Ful>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div><\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <b><br> What we offer:<\u002Fb>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n        <div>\n         <ul>\n          <li> Clear learning and development opportunities to build your knowledge, skills, and behaviours to prepare you for your career at Skanska<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Professional networks and mentoring to ensure success<\u002Fli>\n          <li> The opportunity to work towards membership of your chosen professional body<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Project management and leadership development mentoring<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Opportunities to volunteer at least one day per year<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Competitive benefits package<\u002Fli>\n          <li> Inclusive environment where everyone is encouraged and supported to be ‘their whole self’<\u002Fli>\n         <\u002Ful>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <br> Skanska, one of the world’s leading project development and construction groups, is an inclusive and responsible business that is helping to build a better society.\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <br> Drawing on our Scandinavian heritage, we are green, innovative, and progressive. We bring together people and technology, as part of our objective to make construction a safer and more collaborative industry.\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <br> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation, and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p>Skanska, one of the world’s leading project development and construction groups, is an inclusive and responsible business that is helping to build a better society.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Skanska is the Delivery Integration Partner (DIP) on Highways England's Regional Development Partnership (RDP) Framework within the Midlands and East Regions<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> The Project<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> As part of the framework we are leading on a £282 million project to improve junction 6 of the M42. The scheme, delivered on behalf of National Highways, provides a comprehensive upgrade of the junction near Birmingham Airport, allowing better movement of traffic on and off the A45.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Once complete road users will benefit from smoother journeys and the work will support and contribute to economic growth in the area.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> You will be report to the Environmental Manager, who will also provide support and development.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> You Will:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Understand the Client and Skanska’s Environment and Sustainability Policies, Processes and statutory requirements as they affect the contract's operations and ensure that the requirements are implemented on the project.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Provide Environmental compliance advice to various team, including construction, procurement and subcontractors and suppliers on the practical implementation of contract policies, processes and requirements.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure works are in line with the Environmental Management System, certified to ISO 14001:2015, ensuring it remains appropriate to all contract risks. Monitor and collect date to aid reporting against performance against targets.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake a program of inspections and audits, including targeted risk monitoring, both on site and within the supply chain. Assist with any external audits, parent company, client and certification bodies were required.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake environmental monitoring, including noise, vibration, air quality and water quality<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We’re Looking For:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Environmental advisory experience in the environment and construction industry, ideally projects in infrastructure (highways and\u002For railways) . <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Degree or equivalent in Environmental Sciences or suitably applicable fields. Associate or Practitioner Member of the Institute of Environmental Management and Assessment (IEMA) or equivalent and internal auditing experience ideally.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Working knowledge of GIS and BIM360 platforms, as well as other digital tools.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Good organisation and time management skills, able to work independently and off their own initiative.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Confident speaker with experience preparing and delivering presentations.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Demonstrates a passion for the Environment and Sustainability, driving innovation and a desire to positively influence and develop those around them.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Full driving license, as there will be a requirement for the successful candidate to perform that duties around the geographical area of the scheme<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Relevant CSCS Card<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><br> Preferred experience:<\u002Fp>\n      <p> The following areas of experience would be beneficial to you performing this role.<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Biodiversity<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Waste Management<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Carbon<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Archaeology<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Statutory Nuisance<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Environmental Management Plans<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Equal opportunities<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska. <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>Flexible working <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role. <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>Reasonable adjustments <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. Gas\u002FHeating Engineer to join our building services team in Bristol.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Working as a Commercial Gas\u002FHeating Engineer you will carry out mechanical and combustion servicing on all associated gas fired boiler and heating plant, Planned Preventative Services and Reactive Works in time and up to date where required. To carry out Mechanical Services, extra works and emergency procedures. Ensure all Statutory &amp; mandatory compliance maintenance and records\u002Fcertificates are kept up to date at all times in line with the contractual requirements and filed as Skanska Management System. Ensure that CAFM systems and site records are up to date at all times reporting jobs to the helpdesk and in line with Helpdesk requirements. All maintenance tasks to take into account, access, building users and ensure all H&amp;S and contractual paperwork is approved and in place prior to work commencing.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> You’ll<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Perform planned preventative maintenance, statutory compliance tasks and reactive works investigations\u002Frepairs on, but not limited to, the commercial gas fired systems on site<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Service, test, diagnose and repair process control systems and automatic control devices related to the building services gas fired plant and equipment<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Carry out repairs, modifications and installations of plumbing, heating systems and hot\u002Fcold water services in copper, plastic, mdpe, black iron and galvanised pipe using soldering, braising, welding, pressfit and compression methods of fitting<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Where required undertake and implement minor capital works projects<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Implement &amp; comply with the procedures as detailed in the companies IMS, Health &amp; Safety Policies and Statutory obligations<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> We are looking for:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> NVQ Level 3 or equivalent (including recognised apprenticeship) with a commercial gas \u002F heating bias<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Gas Safe registered for commercial gas installations<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Hold the following: COCN1, CIGA1, CORT1, TPCP1\u002F1A, CPA1, CCCN1, COMCAT1<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Maintenance and set up of gas fired burners and radiant tube heaters<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Maintenance of gas pressure regulator installations (PRIs)<\u002Fli>\n       <li><br> Gas Safe registered for catering and domestic installations<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. <\u002Fb>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      2165 \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p>Skanska Technology Ltd (STL) is seeking to recruit a Project Engineer to join our busy design team, based in one of our design offices Bridgend, South Wales or Leavesden, Watford.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> STL provides Civil, Structural, Highways and Infrastructure design services for a wide range of design and build projects within Rail, Highway and Water sectors, amongst others, to both in-house and external clients.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> The Role:<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Reporting to the Senior Project Engineer, you will be responsible for the technical and commercial delivery of highways engineering design projects. This will involve hands on delivery of design, client liaison, fee management and providing technical leadership and direction to the project team.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> This successful candidate will be expected to help grow the team and help secure future workload for the team.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> You Will:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Undertake designs, drawings, specifications and supporting technical reports and other technical output to achieve project outcomes.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake site visits, surveys, and investigations.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure work is undertaken in compliance with Health &amp; Safety and Environmental legislation.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Maintain and increase knowledge of Standards &amp; Codes of Practice.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Participate in CPD activities to ensure skills remain relevant.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Plan and manage delivery of projects to agreed time and cost<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure work is undertaken in compliance with internal quality standards and processes.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Undertake technical training\u002Fmentoring of Engineers, Graduate Engineers and Technicians<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Work collaboratively with customers to understand and develop project objectives and to build excellent customer relationships<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> We are looking for someone with the following:<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><br> A BSc, BEng or MEng in Civil Engineering \u002F Highway \u002F Transportation or similar discipline.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Chartered Engineer with ICE or CIHT.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Experience in design and construction activities within the highway sector including drainage, pavement, and alignment design.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Experience with S38, S278 works.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> In-depth Knowledge of Highways England standards such as the DMRB and MCHW and other relevant design standards<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Working knowledge of software design tools including Key Lines, Key Signs, Civils 3D, AutoCAD, Micro Drainage as appropriate.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Proven track record for the delivery of highways designs, planning, direct &amp; control tasks, people &amp; resources to meet project deadlines and financial targets<\u002Fli>\n       <li> An ability to lead teams &amp; develop staff to meet technical &amp; managerial needs.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> <b>Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> <b>Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. Please contact us using <b>recruitment@skanska.co.uk<\u002Fb> if you require any adjustments that would support you throughout your application.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> <b>More information about the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Please note this is an advert for our job vacancy, and therefore may not be inclusive of all assigned duties, responsibilities, or aspects of the role described, and reputation for delivering high quality projects in Commercial and Mixed-used developments, Healthcare, Custodial, Education and Defence Sectors.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> To build on our success we are looking for an Estimator for Defence to develop the tender information provided on suitable projects into a competent financial tender submission to enable Skanska to secure work and achieve its business needs. You will also prepare cost plans and undertake cost planning exercises that need to be produced to meet the Skanska business needs<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> You will: <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Prepare cost plans and undertake cost planning exercises that need to be produced to meet the Skanska business needs.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Work with the tender\u002Fbidding team to maximise all opportunities and minimise all risks to achieve the best possible project cost for tender settlement.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Prepare all financial elements and components of the tendering process from identification and authorisation to proceed to financial handover and beyond if necessary under supervision.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> On larger projects aid and assist the senior project estimator to develop the information into a competitive cost estimate.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Prepare all necessary financial documents for the Chief Estimator, Operations Director and Managing Director reviews under supervision.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Assist the bidding team with any post tender negotiations as required.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p> We’re looking for: <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Wide range of multi sector tendering experience.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Advanced knowledge of estimation software<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Full understanding of JCT and NEC forms of contract.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Knowledge and understanding of BIM and digital productivity<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Clear understanding of scope and contractual requirements<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ability to develop bid winning commercial strategies to deliver company outcomes.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Equal Solutions &amp; Data Specialist – Development Programme 2023 (London or Southwest)<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Get your career on track (or on motorways, building sites, bridges…) at Skanska<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> We are looking for a graduate Digital Solutions and Data Specialist to join our 2023 development programme and help us shape the future within our Building operating unit in London or the Southwest.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> The Opportunity:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> As a Graduate Digital Solutions Specialist, you will join the Building team’s award-winning public-sector projects which have included Bath Spa University, the Royal London Hospital and Bristol schools. In the private sector, our focus is on commercial and mixed-use buildings. Our expertise in London has created a portfolio that includes some of the capital’s iconic buildings, such as The Gherkin and Heron Tower.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Our two-year graduate programme will help you build on your degree and establish a career where you’ll have the freedom to learn, achieve your ambitions, and leave your mark on the communities in which we work.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> The programme provides a pathway to develop a complete skill set developing both technical and interpersonal skills. This includes courses, on-the-job learning, working in teams to solve business challenges, and building a strong professional network, all while improving the business.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Location:<\u002Fb> You will join our London or Southwest (Gloucester\u002F Bristol) teams. Please specify your preferred location.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> What you will do:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Become a core part of the Digital Transformation team to drive business change in the use of new and emerging digital technologies across the business<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Manage and deliver digital business solutions and technologies at project level<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Plan, develop and implement digital technology business change programmes including setting objectives, priorities and responsibilities<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Become competent at negotiating and closing techniques in a range of interactions and engagements, both with senior internal and external stakeholders<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Demonstrate self-direction and originality in solving problems, and act autonomously in planning and implementing digital and technology solutions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Create and implement innovative technological strategies to support the development of new products, processes and services that align with the company’s digital transformation strategy and develop and communicate compelling business proposals to support these.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Who you are:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Studying towards (in your final year) or having completed a degree in a digital or technology related subject that is accredited by a recognised industry body<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> A keen interest in the use of current and emerging digital solutions technologies to drive business change and improvement<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Values driven and passionate about sustainability<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> A keen interest in emerging technologies within the construction industry<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Have excellent communications skills and attention to detail<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Values driven and passionate about sustainability<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Commercially minded<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Enthusiastic about learning and developing new ways of thinking<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> What we offer:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Clear learning and development opportunities to build your knowledge, skills, and behaviours to prepare you for your career at Skanska<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Professional networks and mentoring to ensure success<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> The opportunity to work towards membership of your chosen professional body<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Project management and leadership development mentoring<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Opportunities to volunteer at least one day per year<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Competitive benefits package<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Inclusive environment where everyone is encouraged and supported to be ‘their whole self’<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> Skanska, one of the world’s leading project development and construction groups, is an inclusive and responsible business that is helping to build a better society.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Drawing on our Scandinavian heritage, we are green, innovative, and progressive. We bring together people and technology, as part of our objective to make construction a safer and more collaborative industry.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> At Skanska, we believe in our Purpose: we build for a better society. Through our Values of care for life, commit to customers, be better – together, and act ethically and transparently you will enable us to deliver our Purpose.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Programme start date<\u002Fb>: September 2023<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Applications closing date:<\u002Fb> 31st December 2022<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> Get in touch with us for more information or apply today!<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. the bid and the ongoing management of all design related issues until project completion.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> You will: <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Assist design complies with Client brief, contract, legislation, town planning, building regulations, CDM and technical requirements<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure that all responsibilities under CDM looking for an Estimator for Defence to develop the tender information provided on suitable projects into a competent financial tender submission to enable Skanska to secure work and achieve its business needs. You will also prepare cost plans and undertake cost planning exercises that need to be produced to meet the Skanska business needs<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> You will: <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Prepare cost plans and undertake cost planning exercises that need to be produced to meet the Skanska business needs.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Work with the tender\u002Fbidding team to maximise all opportunities and minimise all risks to achieve the best possible project cost for tender settlement.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Prepare all financial elements and components of the tendering process from identification and authorisation to proceed to financial handover and beyond if necessary under supervision.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> On larger projects aid and assist the senior project estimator to develop the information into a competitive cost estimate.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Prepare all necessary financial documents for the Chief Estimator, Operations Director and Managing Director reviews under supervision.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Assist the bidding team with any post tender negotiations as required.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p> We’re looking for: <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Wide range of multi sector tendering experience.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Advanced knowledge of estimation software<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Full understanding of JCT and NEC forms of contract.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Knowledge and understanding of BIM and digital productivity<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Clear understanding of scope and contractual requirements<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ability to develop bid winning commercial strategies to deliver company outcomes.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Equal   <div>\n    <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p>Skanska, a leading construction company and developer, is an inclusive and responsible business that is helping to build a better society. Known for many major projects, we are creating, upgrading and maintaining the country’s buildings and infrastructure. Drawing on our Scandinavian heritage, we are green, innovative, and progressive. We bring together people and technology, helping to make our industry safer and more collaborative.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Our infrastructure team brings its design, build and refurbishment expertise to complex projects across the country. We form strong partnerships with clients and communities to deliver major infrastructure improvements like Crossrail, HS2, A14 and the M25 widening.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> As Senior Procurement Manager you will lead and develop the project procurement function, including the development of the project procurement strategy, to successfully procure the relevant trade contract packages, goods and services, to meet the needs of the project. <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b>You Will:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Develop and maintain the procurement strategy and package strategies to meet the needs and requirements of the project.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Manage relationships with all stakeholders involved in the procurement process ensuring stakeholders are dealt with in a professional, open and collaborative way.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Engage with all stakeholders including design, delivery, commercial, HSW, quality, environment and planning functions to ensure the projects requirements are reflected in the procurement process for every procurement<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Participate in the implementation of strategic procedural and practical changes to increase productivity and performance.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Manage the procurement schedule and inputs into the reporting of procurement activity as required by project controls requirements<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure enquiries include robust tender documentation and clarity of projects requirements that seek to always obtain value for money<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensure that accurate and logical tender evaluations are produced to demonstrate value for money <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Conducts supplier meetings and negotiations for all packages to ensure value for money for the project is the objective<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> We're Looking For:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Previous experience as Senior\u002FProcurement Manager on a major project, including managing direct staff<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Previous experience ideally from a similar background or industry (Construction)<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Demonstrable legal, contractual and construction knowledge and experience<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ideally, membership of professional body (RICS, CIPS), or working towards.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Working knowledge of main contract T’s &amp; C’s and also CPA and RPA conditions<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Experience of ERP systems<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. and succession planning, and providing required support projects and intiatives;<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Be responsible for ensuring environmental management compliance and best practice on projects and sites, and continual improvement of the above;<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Provide advice, support and assistance to all project and work winning teams to enable them to manage their environmental responsibilities;<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Support the delivery of BREEAM\u002FLEED\u002FWELL certifications as required on projects and tenders;<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <div>\n       <p> \u002F systems<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Experience \u002F competence generating and delivering improvement initiatives within an operational function or project<\u002Fli>\n       <li> People and team leadership \u002F development experience and capability<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Demonstrable passion and commitment for sustainability, carbon reduction and environmental outcomes<\u002Fli>\n class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Description and requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p>Skanska, one of the world’s leading project development and construction groups, is an inclusive and responsible business that is helping to build a better society.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Skanska is the Delivery Integration Partner (DIP) on Highways England's Regional Development Partnership (RDP) Framework within the Midlands and East Regions<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> The Project<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> As part of the framework we are leading on a £282 million project to improve junction 6 of the M42. The scheme, delivered on behalf of National Highways, provides a comprehensive upgrade of the junction near Birmingham Airport, allowing better movement of traffic on and off the A45.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Once complete road users will benefit from smoother journeys and the work will support and contribute to economic growth in the area.<\u002Fp> \n      <p><b>The Role:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> You Will:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul> \n       <li>Assist in the review of DCO (development consent order) documentation (review of environmental documentation e.g., environmental statement, flood modelling, noise modelling, ecology surveys etc.)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide written environmental reports, management plans and strategies as needed.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide advice, support and assistance to operational and project personnel to enable them to deliver and manage their environmental and sustainable responsibilities and objectives.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist the M42 environmental lead and wider Infrastructure environmental team in any best practice initiatives and delivering ad-hoc improvement projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in the development and delivery of suitable environmental and sustainability training for all project staff.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Represent and promote the Environment Enabling Function in internal and external meetings, workshops, management reviews and forums – communicating best practice standards and initiatives<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b>We are looking for:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul> \n       <li>Degree level in appropriate Environmental or relevant discipline<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Substantiated construction industry experience or relevant environmental experience in a similar sector<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Minimum Practitioner Membership with IEMA or similar professional membership<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Full driving licence and willingness to travel across projects\u002F contracts in region<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent IT skills<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. reputation for delivering high quality projects in Commercial and Mixed-used developments, Healthcare, Custodial, Education and Defence Sectors.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> To build on our success we are looking for a Project Director to lead the Design and Construction process, maximise the teams potential to safely and commercially deliver a successful project. Maintain the Skanska Brand, ensuring Clients, users and local community are proud of and satisfied with their development. approx £25m to £300m.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> You will:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Own and control the Contract Programme, the Mode and Method Strategy, the Target Programme adjustments (through the project planning manager) and the Package split concept (through the commercial lead)<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Chair appropriate management meetings including Client reporting meetings, monthly senior managers briefing meetings, monthly senior team meetings, Health and Safety meetings and briefings and Forecasting and reporting meetings.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Be actively engaged in and have overall responsibility for Method Statements and Risk Assessment before operations commence for all contractors and operatives.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Lead and develop the Project Plan and ensure its implementation reflects the Head Contract<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Agree the high-level financial reporting figures (CVR) with the Commercial Director<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Lead the prelims spend with the other members of the PET team<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Deliver a quality project that meets the clients agreed specification to time and budget. This includes ensuring the appropriate project reporting is completed within the agreed timeframe and providing clear direction to the project team<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p> We’re looking for:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Demonstrable experience of delivering DIO\u002FMOD projects working through PCSA stages, successfully converting and delivering on time and to budget<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Clear understanding of and demonstrable experience of the MOD\u002FDIO, ability to manage expectations and deliver to budgetary constraints<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Demonstrable experience of managing projects from inception through to completion with a value of between £25 and £200m<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Track record in successfully managing and controlling costs, delivering against deadlines, maintaining quality and safety on regional projects.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Experience of full D&amp;B projects would be highly relevant.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Evidence of building effective relationships with clients and key stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b> Equal opportunities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Reasonable adjustments<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process.
